content: - Tardis2238  In 1998, Nintendo created a game that would become one of the greatest games for many gamers; that game was The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time. It would go on to be the benchmark for what a good game should be and went down as a classic, as well. So when Nintendo announced a remastered version of the game on the 3DS, people jumped at the chance to either play it again or play it for the first time. You play as a young boy who, after helping the guardian of your forest, receives a grand quest to save the world. This journey would include swords, monsters, time travel, and world domination. The new, remastered graphics are amazing, showing us that all this really needed was a fresh coat of paint to make it seem modern- but they also made some minor tweaks to the game to make it more enjoyable. They've also added “The Master Quest” for an added challenge. And, with the 3DS’ dual screens, the bottom screen can show your map, so you never get lost. As in the original, the combat is great and a lot of fun, inspiring a lot of other games in other series. Nintendo really went the extra mile to improve their already very successful title, making this the best way you can play Ocarina of Time. I give this game a 9.5/10-close to perfect.
title: Improving Upon Perfection: The Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time 3D
name: improving-upon-perfection-the-legend-of-zelda-ocarina-of-time-3d

content: - Tardis2238 The Star Wars Battlefront 2 beta has come and gone and while it has the makings of a good game, there are some areas I’m concerned about. Here are my thoughts. Pay-to-win aspects are available in game with loot boxes offering upgrades and cosmetics in the same loot box, so if you wanted to pay real money instead of earning in-game credits you could end up getting stronger weapons than other people at your level. But on the contrary, if you’re trying to get a stronger weapon, it would be annoying if you kept getting cosmetic changes since they share the same boxes. The beta also lagged a lot but that’s to be expected.: The game has done away with tokens from Battlefront. These tokens would let you be one of the iconic heroes or villains. In Battlefront 2, you have the ability to gain points to be a hero, villain, or a vehicle and that seems to be a better fit than the tokens. The gameplay seems well done, but the odds seem to be in the Droids’ favor in each stage, which kinda sucks. All in all, it seems like a good game but not one I will be picking up when it comes out. It seems like the biggest thing it has going for it is the Star Wars name and that’s never a good thing, but maybe I’m wrong—maybe it will be amazing come this November. I give this beta a 7/10 worth a shot.
title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 Beta: A First Look

content: - Dragon Scorpion   Over the years, I have noticed that the gaming industry hasn't learned a damn thing from the past when the same practices I saw back in the 80's are happening again. Yes, I'm talking about the great industry crash that Atari caused from crappy game practices and micro-transactions, yet Millennials (also known as Generation Y) seem to be too stupid to understand that these things are bad for gaming today. This bad practice seems to be embraced by Millennials across the world and, when these things are brought up, they defend it like it’s some good thing that the industry is doing. This is not the case, as it is destroying the enjoyment of gaming, plus, having to spend more money on a game that you've paid $60 for? That's just not worth more than what you are paying for. First, it was DLC (Downloadable Content). Most of us were smart enough not to pay for DLC if the game wasn't worth the money. These DLCs were taken out to con us into thinking it’s new content, but were part of the initial production. This is the blind spot most people fail to see and seem to just accept, but accepting this lets companies get away with it more because they think gamers are so stupid that they can get away with making a mediocre game and charging gamers more money to get more things in the game. That is the thing most gamers don't get and when think with their wallets, which is their choice; but they don't realise that they are letting gaming companies get away with grabbing unnecessary money for a game that should've been fully developed in the first place. Now, it’s gone from micro-transactions and DLC to a loot crate system, which is even worse, as it turns the gaming industry into a pay-to-win system. This makes it less about skill and more about spending more on a game that is not worth it. Take the new Star Wars Battlefront 2: EA said they wouldn't be doing DLC for the game- which everyone was hyped about- before realising that EA was still going to use micro-transactions with the loot crate system. According to the game, you have to spend 600 to 700 hours of grinding just to get a gold loot crate with an upgraded weapon. This is so you can progress through the game against players that have high weapons because they've paid for gold create. This forces gamers to actually pay for these loot crates, which are from $10 to $60 each. That is a lot of money to pay, especially when it’s a gamble with $60 you pay for each crate and you don't know what you are getting. In a game, you're paying $10 to $60 at a time for one silver, bronze, or gold crate where you might end up get something worse than what you have or the same thing, wasting money. By the time you get something higher, you could possibly be spending over $400- maybe more on a game you only paid $60 for. This same loot crate system is being used in Middle-earth: Shadow of War, Assassin’s Creed: Origins, and Star Wars Battlefront 2. Because of this, people are now starting to boycott these games because they now see this as a con to gamers. Not to mention Gamestop’s despicable practice with Assassin’s Creed: Origins. You will only get a bonus mission if you pre-order, basically blocking anyone that hasn't pre-ordered and you will have to pay for this DLC later instead of it being free with the game. It’s a joke. It’s because of these practices in the gaming industry that this industry is slowly dying with over paid games and the gaming companies who haven't learn a damn thing. This money-grabbing, corrupt system that gamers are allowing to happen will ultimately destroy the industry in due time, like the Empire destroyed itself in Star Wars for being evil. Question: Do you agree with this or do you have other opinions? Let us know in the comments below what you think of this industry’s practices and loot crate system replacing DLC’s.
title: LootCrate is Killing the Gaming Industry!
name: lootcrate-is-killing-the-gaming-industry

Take the new Star Wars Battlefront 2: EA said they wouldn't be doing DLC for the game- which everyone was hyped about- before realising that EA was still going to use micro-transactions with the loot crate system. According to the game, you have to spend 600 to 700 hours of grinding just to get a gold loot crate with an upgraded weapon. This is so you can progress through the game against players that have high weapons because they've paid for gold create. This forces gamers to actually pay for these loot crates, which are from $10 to $60 each. That is a lot of money to pay, especially when it’s a gamble with $60 you pay for each crate and you don't know what you are getting. In a game, you're paying $10 to $60 at a time for one silver, bronze, or gold crate where you might end up get something worse than what you have or the same thing, wasting money. By the time you get something higher, you could possibly be spending over $400- maybe more on a game you only paid $60 for. This same loot crate system is being used in Middle-earth: Shadow of War, Assassin’s Creed: Origins, and Star Wars Battlefront 2. Because of this, people are now starting to boycott these games because they now see this as a con to gamers. Not to mention Gamestop’s despicable practice with Assassin’s Creed: Origins. You will only get a bonus mission if you pre-order, basically blocking anyone that hasn't pre-ordered and you will have to pay for this DLC later instead of it being free with the game. It’s a joke. It’s because of these practices in the gaming industry that this industry is slowly dying with over paid games and the gaming companies who haven't learn a damn thing. This money-grabbing, corrupt system that gamers are allowing to happen will ultimately destroy the industry in due time, like the Empire destroyed itself in Star Wars for being evil. Question: Do you agree with this or do you have other opinions? Let us know in the comments below what you think of this industry’s practices and loot crate system replacing DLC’s.
title: LootCrate is Killing the Gaming Industry!
name: 216-revision-v1

content: - Tardis2238  In 1998, Nintendo created a game that would become one of the greatest games for many gamers; that game was The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time. It would go on to be the benchmark for what a good game should be and went down as a classic, as well. So when Nintendo announced a remastered version of the game on the 3DS, people jumped at the chance to either play it again or play it for the first time. You play as a young boy who, after helping the guardian of your forest, receives a grand quest to save the world. This journey would include swords, monsters, time travel, and world domination. The new, remastered graphics are amazing, showing us that all this really needed was a fresh coat of paint to make it seem modern- but they also made some minor tweaks to the game to make it more enjoyable. They've also added “The Master Quest” for an added challenge. And, with the 3DS’ dual screens, the bottom screen can show your map, so you never get lost. As in the original, the combat is great and a lot of fun, inspiring a lot of other games in other series. Nintendo really went the extra mile to improve their already very successful title, making this the best way you can play Ocarina of Time. I give this game a 9.5/10-close to perfect.
title: Improving Upon Perfection: The Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time 3D
name: 199-revision-v1

content:
- Satirical Spitfire
  We’ve seen them online, if we haven’t seen them in the conventions. They are the models of the geek community--if they fit our standards. Some of us have had private time with them and others wish they did. We critique them more than any other group within any other community. They are cosplayers. Those who choose to don the costumes of their favorite characters often become the objects of affection or disgust by simply existing, and this toxicity--the conflict of separating the game from reality-- is what’s wrong with cosplay. Let’s start with this--cosplayers are not objects. It should be a basic moral understanding, buuuuuut I guess not. You don’t touch people without permission-- poking, kissing, groping, or otherwise. Costumes and makeup don’t change that,. Another thing--they aren’t wearing it for you. Yes, attention is desired (and I don’t mean the desire to touch them or bed them or wed them)--but they are more than likely wearing it for themselves and other fans. Critiques are expected and there a forums for that, where costumers and makeup artists come together and improve themselves, but the ridiculous remarks about how they don’t fit your standards are, well, ridiculous. Does it look like she cares that she’s a size 16 Princess Zelda? Does he care that he’s not the same ethnicity as Batman? Do they care that they aren’t the same gender as Samus? Does he care that he’s rocking the kilt without undies? (Yes because the look you gave him is fucking hilarious). The answer to the other three was a resounding, “No”. They all care about having fun, which is something some individuals apparently don’t understand. Which isn’t to say that all cosplayers are supportive of each other either. There is animosity even within the microcosm, which makes it difficult for others to respect and support other cosplayers. Not-Pro-Tip: If you want respect from others, respect your own damn community. Stick up for each other; help each other; protect each other. Regardless of the skill levels or costuming preferences, they don’t need approval to wear the masks, wigs, or weapons of their idols. What they do need is for people to not touch them, demean them, or otherwise harass them and be an asshole. Don’t like their costume? That’s cool--just keep walking.
title: Cosplay Community Now on Notice

content: - Tardis2238 The Star Wars Battlefront 2 beta has come and gone and while it has the makings of a good game, there are some areas I’m concerned about. Here are my thoughts. Pay-to-win aspects are available in game with loot boxes offering upgrades and cosmetics in the same loot box, so if you wanted to pay real money instead of earning in-game credits you could end up getting stronger weapons than other people at your level. But on the contrary, if you’re trying to get a stronger weapon, it would be annoying if you kept getting cosmetic changes since they share the same boxes. The beta also lagged a lot but that’s to be expected.: The game has done away with tokens from Battlefront. These tokens would let you be one of the iconic heroes or villains. In Battlefront 2, you have the ability to gain points to be a hero, villain, or a vehicle and that seems to be a better fit than the tokens. The gameplay seems well done, but the odds seem to be in the Droids’ favor in each stage, which kinda sucks. All in all, it seems like a good game but not one I will be picking up when it comes out. It seems like the biggest thing it has going for it is the Star Wars name and that’s never a good thing, but maybe I’m wrong—maybe it will be amazing come this November. I give this beta a 7/10 worth a shot.
title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 Beta: A First Look

title: Mom Gamer Yells at Child On Stream

content: by Penguingod   “STOP SPITTING ON THE FLOOR!” Was more or less the highlight of the “Call Of Duty WW2 Uncensored” podcast by the Laggin’ Out team, but what happened afterwards, with the mom yelling at her child over the stream, is what’s even more intriguing.   Did she punish him? Did she string him up by his ankles and have him recite the alphabet 57 times (like what my mom did to me growing up)? Did she make him wear a 50lb bag and have him run the New York Marathon with promises of chocolate cake at the end of the road, but the kicker was that there was no cake?   No. None of these happened but a simple grounding, and a spanking, and telling the child “This is gonna hurt me more than it’s gonna hurt you.” What was more punishment was the humiliation of the internet seeing a mother having to go through that, but there is hope.   She could be the next big meme. She could be internet famous for being the woman with no chill toward her child who was just trying to spit some bars but took it too literal.   Hey, he could have been the next Eminem, rapping about a president who has taken things too far. He could be rapping about getting money and fuckin’ bitches while smoking that good Cali kush. I know I’d punish my kid if he tried being a Trap Rapper. “Dammit, Cletus! You stop that mumble rapping shit, otherwise I’m gonna give you the five knuckle shuffle and then hit you with the people’s elbow from top rope!” Either way, I hope the kid didn’t get taken to Suplex City because that’s a domestic disturbance. Well, that’s it for this one. Till next time, this is Penguin, sliding off the ice! [embedyt] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mh8edByeHkk[/embedyt]
title: Mom Yells on Child on Stream
name: mom-yells-on-child-on-stream

content: Tardis2238   Naughty Dog is known as one of the best video game developers out there, making amazing games such as Uncharted and The Last Of Us. But recently, claims of sexual harassment have surfaced on Twitter from former employee David Ballard. It reads:   “In 2015, I was sexually harassed at Naughty Dog by a lead. My work environment became extremely toxic afterward. In February 2016, I had a mental breakdown at work and Sony PlayStation HR became involved. When I told them about the harassment[,] they ended the call and fired me the next day. They cited [that] the company was moving in a different direction and my job was no longer needed. They tried to silence me by offering $20,000 if I signed a letter agreeing to the termination as well as to not discuss it with anyone. I declined to sign. I have been unemployed for 17 months since. When interviewers ask why I left Naughty Dog, I say I was burned out by the crunch, ashamed to get to the root of the problem of being sexually harassed. I’m speaking out now because of the strength I’ve seen in others coming forward about their experiences in the TV/Film industry. This is the hardest thing I’ve ever done. I will not let anyone kill my drive or love for the video game industry, my passions, or life.”   In response, Naughty Dog put out this statement.   “We have recently read on social media that an ex-employee of Naughty Dog, Dave Ballard, claims he was sexually harassed when he worked at Naughty Dog. We have not found any evidence of having received allegations from Mr. Ballard that he was harassed in anyway at Naughty Dog or Sony Interactive Entertainment. Harassment and inappropriate conduct have no place at Naughty Dog and Sony Interactive Entertainment. We have taken and always will take reports of sexual harassment and other workplace grievances very seriously. We value every single person who works at Naughty Dog and Sony Interactive Entertainment. It is of utmost importance that we maintain a safe, productive workplace environment that allows us to channel our shared passion for making games.”   If this is true, it would be another instance of a powerful person abusing said power to hurt those beneath them.   We must learn to speak up if we ever witness such an act in front of us. If this turns out to be true, would you still buy games from Naughty Dog? Tell us down in the comments.
title: Naughty Dog Sexual Harrassment Scandal
name: naughty-dog-sexual-harrassment-scandal

content: Written by Movie Knights Story: When his dysfunctional family clashes over the holidays, young Max (Emjay Anthony) is disillusioned and turns his back on Christmas. Little does he know that this lack of festive spirit has unleashed the wrath of Krampus, a demonic force of ancient evil intent on punishing non-believers. All hell breaks loose as beloved holiday icons take on a monstrous life of their own, laying siege to the fractured family's home and forcing them to fight for each other if they hope to survive.   Likes : First of all, great storytelling of an age-old Christmas nightmare of Krampus, who, if you forget the Christmas Spirit, will come to collect your parents as punishment and leave one alive to witness the horror so Christmas is never forgotten again. If you compare this to other films of this concept, none of them have actually captured the true element of Krampus quite like this one. I wanted to see this at the cinema, but I thought it would’ve been just another horrible, low budget Syfy Channel-typical movie, so I waited for it to come out on DVD after a few months and I finally got to watch it for the first time. Upon watching this film, I was pleasantly surprised to see that this was actually really good. I love the style of the nightmarish tone, using motifs from nightmares and Christmas as well; especially with the gingerbread men, which was probably the cheesiest thing ever, but damn funny. It’s twisted, laughing because it’s a horror film and not a Christmas one, but you just can't help yourself. What was also great about this film was the full backstory of Krampus- of what he is and what he does when the Christmas Spirit dies. It’s kind of a frightening concept with an ice cold chill, with this story being told in a creepy, animated fashion. When the grandmother tells the family, it’s a brilliantly done animation-style flashback, which stands out in the film with a pretty dark and chilled-to-the-bone story. It adds to the film’s atmosphere, which is cool because it gives the film some edge setting up the scenes perfectly for what comes next. The film has a very similar concept to “The Gremlins,” yet with a darker, nightmarish tone.   It’s one of those films that, despite being a horror film, you find yourself laughing your head off at with certain bits throughout the film; begs the question where your moral compass is at.   Although the film does have some funny scenes, there is a great balance of horror and comedy throughout the film, with chilling scenes that put the fear of Krampus in your soul. But, unfortunately, it’s not as over-the-top scary as it could've been. It was more of a weird and funny type of horror that you could see becoming a cult classic, for sure.   With great acting performances from Adam Scott, Toni Collette, David Koechner, Allison Tolman, Krista Stadler, and Emjay Anthony, the film was incredibly convincing in areas. David Koechner, being a comedy actor, really did well with the serious parts as well as the funny scenes .   All in all, this is a pretty well-told story of Krampus and is actually the best one I've seen in awhile. It is one of those films you really have to watch to get and enjoy, especially the twisted ending that leaves you baffled for a second; then you get this “Jeepers Creepers” ending that was brilliantly done. It’s one of the best endings I've seen that leaves things to the imagination.   Dislikes : I think the film was missing some opportunities where there could've been other people involved fighting for their lives, but, as it is, this is a cool film for a horror story.   Overall : Great story telling, funny moments with some chilling moments throughout the film, worth checking out. Rating: 5 out of 5 for entertainment / 8 out of 10 for story telling
title: Krampus Review
name: krampus-review

content:
Written by Movie Knights   In the world of cinema over the past few years, we seem to be in a flux of reboots and remakes of original films. Some haven't been awful, but others have been atrocious. It’s these bad ones that make us think, “What was the point in trying to make a reboot/remake in the first place?”   In this article, I'm going to try to give an in-depth look at these reboots versus the original films and try to explain why some of these fail, whereas some actually work. So, here are a few reboots versus their originals.  
  • Evil Dead vs. Evil Dead (Reboot)
This film should've been left well enough alone, especially when Evil Dead is such a classic in the horror genre. With a comedic attitude, Bruce Campbell plays the unwitting boyfriend who unleashes an ancient evil force from the “Book of the Dead” which takes his girlfriend and his friends. It quickly becomes a funny—but disturbing—blood fest in a battle of good versus evil.   Most would disagree or agree with me about the reboot as it does try it’s best to come up with something original, but still slightly tries to copy what's been done before with Bruce Campbell version but this was its downfall as the original is better than this rendition.    
  • Poltergeist vs. Poltergeist (Remake)
Now this original film is special to me. When I first watched this film, it was one of the creepiest films I'd ever seen, even though it was given a PG rating. (To this day, I think that was a mistake because although Poltergeist is classed as a fantasy film, it is still a psychological horror that wasn't under any circumstances a family film.)   Sadly, after three films, the child actress Heather O'Rourke who played the little girl, Carol Anna, passed away from a rare child bowel disease. This led to the development of the famous curse theory. Which Supposedly several actors and actresses died because of the real skeletons that was used on set. Which is more than a little weird.   The remake of the original Poltergeist didn't do too badly, but ultimately it failed for the same reason as the Evil Dead reboot. With a scene mentioning a house disappearing as a joke at the dinner table, this film tries to copy what's been done before. It was an enjoyable film to watch as it had it’s moments special with a news scene where we saw what's on the other side (i.e the ghost world). But sadly this didn't save it as it flopped in the cinema.  
  • Ghostbusters vs. Ghostbusters (Reboot)
Yes, I know this is beating a dead horse, but let’s face it: Sony made a pretty big mistake in giving this film a reboot instead of making a third film. The original worked because of comedic time and off-script acting. This gave the original a balanced of a dark creepy film with comedic moments that breaks up the doom and gloom of the film, which made it a classic cult movie of the 80's.   Sadly for the Ghostbusters 2016 movie, which has been met with hostile criticism, didn’t work out for Sony as it took a major hit in losses in box office...mainly due to the fact Amy Pascal and Paul Feig turned Ghostbusters into an SNL (Saturday Night Live) film.  
  • Magnificent Seven vs. Magnificent Seven (Reboot)
Here is a rare example of a film that's been rebooted that has actually been a good rendition. Both have similar traits: a group of corrupt government officials use their official title to run a town with an iron fist, and the town folk hire a U.S. marshal to take them down. I’m hard pressed to tell which one was better, as they are both good in their own right. This is because the reboot version mixed up the film a little and didn't try to copy what was done before.  
  • Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles vs. Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (Reboot)
This is probably the most hated reboot in the history of cinema. Even though I grew up on the original Turtles movies, the reboot didn't really bother me that much as it did most others; from the originals the first two films were good, but sadly the third film wasn't that great. So I agree that Turtles movies needed a reboot.   My first choice wouldn't of been Megan Fox playing April o'Neil, but she didn't do too bad. I’ll let you decide if this was a good movie, as it had mixed reviews.  
  • Nightmare on Elm Street vs. Nightmare on Elm Street (Reboot)
Now this one is a pretty easy choice to make to which one of the nightmare on elm street movies we’re the best out of the two versions, which no offence to “Jackie Earle Haley” who's a great actor and did his best with the script for the new "Nightmare on Elm st" film but i feel personally that Robert Englund should have reprised the role. Which is why the remake failed to make what impact it could plus it did take the story a little too dark on the child moltser / serial killer side of the Freddy Krueger character, which i don't think was it’s downfall but maybe put some people off. I believe the “Downfall” just came from poor concept writing, where the film could've used the sleep deprivation concept better with a more darker, creepier tone with more Freddy Krueger scene it  might of worked. As it stands the original "Nightmare on Elm street " still stands as the best classic and icon film of it generation that should’ve of seen the return of "Robert Englund" as Freddy in a more darker film, it could've been a success and the fan-base would have loved his return to the franchise.  
  • Robocop vs Robocop (Reboot)
Here a film that could've of been good as its original yet it just fails in comparison due to the factor of bring down the reboot certification to a 12A vs the R-rated version of the original “Robocop”. The 12A - PG13 as i've said in a previous article i wrote of the decline of horror films, it's important not to tone down a character special if they need that R-rating to actually work for it’s concept which sadly they did here.   Not that the reboot wasn't good, it had it’s entertainment value but without that R-rating the character didn't have the impact, plus changing the suit of Armour to look black was another reason this film failed because believe it or not the new design actually looked better in the classic silver Armour.   This sadly is why the original film will always be the best of the two version.  
  • Friday the 13th vs Friday the 13th (Reboot)
What is it about this iconic serial killer that Hollywood can’t seem to get right? It’s one of the most easiest characters to give a good concept script for. We have had over ten films of the original “Friday the 13th” film including Freddy vs Jason spin off film, they attempted a reboot of the film which wasn't that bad but still missing something this character so needed which sadly didn't do so well in box office. Original films will always stand the test of time and will always be great classic films, but for a reboot yes their attempt was great but not good enough. If I was a film writer I would capitalize on the supernatural side of Jason voorhees, i would use the mist teleportation effects like a demon in a dark using the creepiness on the night but with a more bloodthirsty tone with more than just a few campers.  
  • Terminator vs Terminator Genisys (Reboot)
Where do i start with this? Terminator first came out this as one of the biggest franchise movies to hit the cinema, spawning 4 films and a reboot, although the third film was a bit of a let down and some would say Terminator salvation was just the franchise killer. Although i would attend to agree that salvation was a good film but the ending of that film did kind of kill anymore films from being done, so technically “Terminator” and “Terminator 2 Judgement Day T-1000 Edition” were really the only two films in the franchise that were a massive success.   In light of salvation this franchise was rebooted with the return of Arnold playing the T-101 killing machine, only in “Genisys” playing a Terminator father figure for a more hardened Sarah Connor with a mixed concept of “Terminator and Terminator 2” might of been its downfall. Plus with sky-net actually killing John Connor as well by turning him into an advanced Terminator which was supposed to lead the future of mankind against the machines, kind of throws the franchise off level to the point you couldn't really take it anywhere. So again the original wins out of this one.   Honorable mention of  Reboot / Remake to come: Ace Ventura                                       Akira Big Trouble In Little China                  The Black Hole Blade                                                   spawn Bloodsport                                           Blue Thunder Deathwish                                          Few others These are just a few reboots around, what reboot do you think was better than its original or do you think the original was better? Let us know in the comments below.   edited by r/m
title: Films: Original vs Reboot
name: films-original-vs-reboot

content: by Penguingod   “STOP SPITTING ON THE FLOOR!” Was more or less the highlight of the “Call Of Duty WW2 Uncensored” podcast by the Laggin’ Out team, but what happened afterwards, with the mom yelling at her child over the stream, is what’s even more intriguing.   Did she punish him? Did she string him up by his ankles and have him recite the alphabet 57 times (like what my mom did to me growing up)? Did she make him wear a 50lb bag and have him run the New York Marathon with promises of chocolate cake at the end of the road, but the kicker was that there was no cake?   No. None of these happened but a simple grounding, and a spanking, and telling the child “This is gonna hurt me more than it’s gonna hurt you.” What was more punishment was the humiliation of the internet seeing a mother having to go through that, but there is hope.   She could be the next big meme. She could be internet famous for being the woman with no chill toward her child who was just trying to spit some bars but took it too literal.   Hey, he could have been the next Eminem, rapping about a president who has taken things too far. He could be rapping about getting money and fuckin’ bitches while smoking that good Cali kush. I know I’d punish my kid if he tried being a Trap Rapper. “Dammit, Cletus! You stop that mumble rapping shit, otherwise I’m gonna give you the five knuckle shuffle and then hit you with the people’s elbow from top rope!” Either way, I hope the kid didn’t get taken to Suplex City because that’s a domestic disturbance. Well, that’s it for this one. Till next time, this is Penguin, sliding off the ice! [embedyt] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mh8edByeHkk[/embedyt]
title: Mom Yells on Child on Stream
name: 305-autosave-v1

content: Tardis2238        In recent years Assassin's Creed has begun to grow stale, having become a yearly release that shunned innovation. Last year Ubisoft had decided to take a year to make the next game, it was seen as a good idea to almost everyone, and boy did they change it.        You play as Bayek, a man who after losing his son goes on a quest for revenge, meeting important people all over Egypt, and eventually creating the Assassin’s brotherhood.        Egypt is a beautiful place full of mysteries and secrets. The level of detail gone into this landscape is stunning.        The gameplay has taken on more than a few RPG aspects with quest items, damage numbers coming out of enemies when you hit them, a leveling up system, and a skill tree.        Combat is still a weak link even though it’s way better than it use to be. The best way to describe it is a dumbed down Bloodborne style of fighting.        Unfortunately it doesn’t do anything other people haven’t done before not to mention they still have the boring modern day sections, but good news is they’re very short.        They’re also working on many extra stuff for later on like a virtual museum, and being able to fight four Egyptian gods later on.        While I really enjoyed this new Assassin’s Creed entry I can see some parts still need work. I really hope they keep tweaking the formula instead of letting it grow old. I give this game a 8.1/10, it’s pretty good.
title: Assassin's Creed Origins: Back on Track?
name: assassins-creed-origins-back-on-track

content: Tardis2238   In recent years Assassin's Creed has begun to grow stale, having become a yearly release that shunned innovation. Last year Ubisoft had decided to take a year to make the next game, it was seen as a good idea to almost everyone, and boy did they change it.   You play as Bayek, a man who after losing his son goes on a quest for revenge, meeting important people all over Egypt, and eventually creating the Assassin’s brotherhood. Egypt is a beautiful place full of mysteries and secrets. The level of detail gone into this landscape is stunning. The gameplay has taken on more than a few RPG aspects with quest items, damage numbers coming out of enemies when you hit them, a leveling up system, and a skill tree. Combat is still a weak link even though it’s way better than it use to be. The best way to describe it is a dumbed down Bloodborne style of fighting. Unfortunately it doesn’t do anything other people haven’t done before not to mention they still have the boring modern day sections, but good news is they’re very short. They’re also working on many extra stuff for later on like a virtual museum, and being able to fight four Egyptian gods later on.   While I really enjoyed this new Assassin’s Creed entry I can see some parts still need work. I really hope they keep tweaking the formula instead of letting it grow old. I give this game a 8.1/10, it’s pretty good.
title: Assassins creed origins: Back on track?
name: 322-revision-v1

content: Tardis2238        In recent years Assassin's Creed has begun to grow stale, having become a yearly release that shunned innovation. Last year Ubisoft had decided to take a year to make the next game, it was seen as a good idea to almost everyone, and boy did they change it.        You play as Bayek, a man who after losing his son goes on a quest for revenge, meeting important people all over Egypt, and eventually creating the Assassin’s brotherhood.      Egypt is a beautiful place full of mysteries and secrets. The level of detail gone into this landscape is stunning.      The gameplay has taken on more than a few RPG aspects with quest items, damage numbers coming out of enemies when you hit them, a leveling up system, and a skill tree.      Combat is still a weak link even though it’s way better than it use to be. The best way to describe it is a dumbed down Bloodborne style of fighting.      Unfortunately it doesn’t do anything other people haven’t done before not to mention they still have the boring modern day sections, but good news is they’re very short.      They’re also working on many extra stuff for later on like a virtual museum, and being able to fight four Egyptian gods later on.        While I really enjoyed this new Assassin’s Creed entry I can see some parts still need work. I really hope they keep tweaking the formula instead of letting it grow old. I give this game a 8.1/10, it’s pretty good.

title: Assassin's Creed Origins: Back on Track?
name: 322-revision-v1

content: Tardis2238   Just like its predecessor Shadow of Mordor, Middle Earth: Shadow of War is a very satisfying game set in Tolkien’s Lord of the rings universe.   You play as Talion a man who, after being killed by the forces of evil, he and the ring maker Celebrimbor, end up sharing a body. After the events of the first game,they decide to make a new ring of power.   The combat is very satisfying even though it’s ripping off most of the Batman Arkham games combat style. It’s so awesome being able to take down 10 to 15 bad guys without getting hit once.   Of course the best thing about this game is the nemesis system which let you fight truly unique enemies with fears, strengths, and weaknesses. You can even be attacked by your own allies if they get killed or defeated they might turn traitor.   Now the bad, this game is very repetitive it reuses and recycles the big stronghold battles a few times not to mention I encountered a lot of glitches, and you’ll have to constantly swap out your troops to keep up with the increasing difficulty. It also plays fast and loose with the canon.   Ultimately this is an ok game which wishes it was amazing it’s got some great aspects the biggest being the universe but the repetitiveness really weighs it down. I give this game a 7/10 about average.
title: Middle Earth: Shadow of War
name: middle-earth-shadow-of-war

name: 330-revision-v1

content: Scampering Panda        The land was steeped in violence. The vast land’s lack of a governing power incite war as clans battled for greater control. Then, the rift happened. The continents split, but the ground was not the only thing that opened that day. The rift opened a portal to another world. The gateway now open, monsters, demons, and otherworldly creatures poured into the land causing chaos all across the Iron Grip. The once divided people now fought together to end the darkness threatening the land. Many fell to the demons. In their most desperate hour, seven heroes rose up. Going into the very rift through which the filth poured, these seven mighty warriors pushed back their advance and closed the rift. They carefully sealed it away for what they hoped would be the rest of time. In gratitude, the people of the land agreed to follow the seven as the newly formed Iron Grip. Tristram Octovian, Bazur Gogron, Redra Grun, Elm Pumpkindust, Sid Sange, Rujin Erasto, and Zadock Frank Beeching each took control of a different continent. Together they brought peace and tranquility to the land for the first time. The seven were not unaffected by their trip to the rift. Years, decades, centuries went by with not one of the seven showing age. It seemed they would rule the land forever. Until that one fateful day.          January 15, 1843-a date that would be remembered for years to come. For on this day one of the mighty Iron Grip was found dead in his bed. Tristram Octovian was found with a bullet through his head. As news spread so did the rumors. He had been killed by a shadow faction, he grew tired of living and committed suicide, or maybe he had been killed by his own companions in the Iron Grip as they were now fighting amongst themselves. The peace the land knew shattered like glass.          It is in the midst of this chaos that our six adventurers find themselves in WavesWorld an eclectic, peaceful city. Their paths cross when they all find themselves patrons of an inn run by a boisterous, yet beautiful, woman named Tammy Homesworth. Smelling a delicious breakfast spread prepared by their generous hostess they trickle downstairs where they finally meet. A beautiful young female merchant from a distant land named Asuha and Devlin, a blonde-haired priest with elegant features, are the first to officially meet as the two simultaneously exit their rooms. They find themselves quickly joined by two more of the patrons. The shocking appearance of a cinder skinned Fireborn male with flame for hair and a pale female Tiefling with large black antlers and indigo hair causes Devlin to recoil from the “demons”. Umber tries to explain he is no demon, but Cadence just rolls her pupil-less Tiefling eyes and continues on to the feast. Umber joins her. Devlin seats himself as far away from them as possible where Asuha also seats herself. Umber and Cadence become instant friends through their mutual taunting of Devlin. Halfway through breakfast, a large barbarian wanders in off the street, and without asking seats himself at the table and begins to eat. They are an unlikely band with no particular reason to stay together, so after breakfast, they all go about their various tasks.          Eventually, the group finds themselves together again across from the Inn at the local bar which just happens to be run by Tammy’s twin sister Jenny. Andre the barbarian offers some ale to Umber who finds his constitution too weak to handle the sheer quantity he was offered. Passed out drunk, Andre attempts to carry him back to the inn, but he himself has fallen to the effects of the twenty-something pitchers of ale he himself drank. In his drunken rage, Andre begins a stand-off with some guard at the door. Sensing a bar brawl bound to unfold Cadence attempted to diffuse the situation by charming the guard’s commander, and everything went black. When the troupe woke they were sitting bound in a row before the commander. He was a tall man with shockingly white hair, a large rifle strapped to his back, and a pistol that he brandished in his hand who introduced himself as Percy. A guard is sent to retrieve Albert the final tenant of the inn. Moments later the guard returned with a young teenage boy and his mechanical duck. He is bound and added to the row. After some tense one-sided negotiations that nearly took the life of Asuha the group is offered a deal. They will all be allowed to go free should they find where the people of the town have been disappearing. More importantly, if they discover the whereabouts of Percy’s own nephew and the leader of the city King Lawrence.        After some investigation, a battle with a werewolf, rescuing the twin sisters, and a visit from a mysterious stranger, the group decided Percy could not be trusted, except for Asuha who placed her lot in with Percy. Tammy and Jenny shaken from their experience fled the city in the night while the band slept in their rooms. The only reminder of their presence was a singular note from the sisters offering information should the group choose to join them outside of town. Despite an offer to join Percy’s forces the group minus Asuha rushed off to the designated meeting spot. Asuha pledged her allegiance to Percy before scribbling a note and setting off for the cemetery rendezvous as well. All would seem to converge on that unholy place that night. The group battled risen dead before finding Tammy and Jenny anxious to leave. Asuha reveals herself and offers a note explaining Percy’s hunt for the twins, but before she can leave Percy reveals himself. A fierce battle ensued where the group fought Percy. Cadence fought inner demons, and Asuha sought to take out Jenny in an attempt to appease Percy. Together the group proved fierce foes for Percy who was narrowly saved by the mysterious stranger. Ragged after two intense battles, Tammy and Jenny take the band of adventurers, and now captive Asuha, to the camp they had prepared; dinner is eaten. Many of the group go to bed. Cadence takes the opportunity to confide some of her horrid past to Umber before the two part and also go to bed.        In the night, Albert receives a visit from the mysterious visitor who informs him that Percy is planning to take military control of all the major cities. Then the mysterious stranger once again vanished into the night. The ragtag group come together again in the morning for breakfast. Tammy and Jenny shared what information they could on Percy, and Albert relayed the mysterious stranger’s message. Camp was packed and the adventurer’s set out in agreement to move on to the next town and search for a way to stop Percy’s quest for dominance.        Their travels took them through a mysterious forest filled with odd owl creatures watching their every move. The path to the village was blocked by a raised bridge. While they attempted to find a way across the bridge a mysterious owl humanoid appeared. Tammy and Jenny seemed unaware of its presence.  When it pulled a small flute from under its cloak Cadence immediately plugged her ears. Some of the others followed suit but that did not prevent some of the group from falling under the musical spell. The world around them faded and they were given visions of happy times in their lives. Andre saw a time long since past surrounded by comrades. Asuha saw her mother who told Asuha for the first time that she was proud of her daughter. Umber saw his first meeting and the immediate kinship with someone he now felt holds dear. As the figure faded so did the illusion. Then the bridge came slamming down before them.        The town was not what they had expected. It seemed oddly vacant with no villagers about at midday. Asuha bid farewell to the group just after entering the gate. After brief banter, it was decided Tammy would go after Asuha while the others waited in the village. Left to their own devices they all went about various tasks. Cadence, lost in thought, settled by the pool to play her harp. It wasn’t long before Devlin noticed Tammy had returned. She was worn from battle and did not make it through the gate before passing out. Devlin rushed to her aid soon followed by the others. They stabilized her before bringing her to her sister at the tavern.        The commotion caught the attention of one of the villagers, a young girl who immediately ran after the group in excitement. Jenny began to take care of her sister while the young female interjected herself. Before introductions could be completed Jenny rushed from the tavern to the pond where she threw her sister in and began casting a spell. The group looked on in shock as Jenny then stabbed herself before falling into the pool as well. Minutes passed before magically Tammy raised from the pool and lay unconscious on the bank. Umber jumped into the now illuminated pool after Jenny, but when he entered the light he did not find her. Instead, he saw visions of the twin’s past before he was ejected from the light as well. Cadence held out her hand to help him out of the pool. When the light faded Jenny’s body could be seen at the base of the pool. Umber again went after her. It took Andre’s help, but they were able to bring her to the bank as well.      It seemed as if they had revived her, but instead, she began vomiting a mysterious black sludge. Nothing anyone tried seem to help when a familiar figure appeared before Cadence. The owl figure from the forest stood before her unmoving. Cadence shaken by the whole ordeal pleaded for its  help. All watched as the entity silently forced the black liquid back into Jenny. She now as well as her sister lay unconscious but alive. This help was not without a cost. The entity told Cadence she would need to return the favor in the future. Exhausted and needing a place to rest the group gathered up the sisters to follow the newest addition to their hodge podge group to the nearest inn.   The story continues Fridays at 7 p.m. Eastern time.
title: Black Citadel Asylum
name: black-citadel-asylum

title: Home
name: home-2

content: Tardis2238   Mario returns in his greatest adventure to date in Super Mario Odyssey, a true love letter to Nintendo’s past Mario titles. In this game, Mario is better than ever with better mobility and new powers, not to mention over 500 power moons to get.   You, of course, play as gaming’s greatest platformer, Mario, who, after losing Princess Peach to Bowser again, has to go on a journey to rescue her. This time, you’ll be joined by Cappy, a shapeshifting hat, who can CAPture (see what I did there?) enemies and use their powers for himself.   Being a Nintendo game, the gameplay is almost perfect. Never before has it felt so good to be Mario. You can also get to places that would’ve been impossible without Cappy. This isn’t a hard game by any means but there are hard parts.   The story is, as usual, the weakest part of any Mario game, but it’s not as bad as it usually is. This time, Bowser actually has a plan beyond kidnapping Peach; he’s trying to force a marriage between himself and the princess, and to do this, he’s enlisted some help. The Broodals are a group of rabbits that are tasked with helping their boss with his wedding and keeping our hero from interfering.   The capture system is a lot of fun and really shows that Nintendo still knows what they’re doing.   The kingdoms are really well done as well, showing off amazing level design that only true masters could achieve. If you want to 100% this game, you’ll have to look over every nook and cranny.   You can really feel all the love and affection put into this game,in fact, I’d go so far as to say it’s one of the best games on the Switch. I’d give this game a 9.5/10- near perfect.
title: Super Mario Odyssey: Best Switch Game?
name: super-mario-odyssey-best-switch-game

content: Movie Knights Story: 2977: For many years a mighty battle has been raging across the galaxies as 500 billion humans, whose forebears were exiled from Earth, plan to return to what is still called home. Forced to flee a ravaged Earth, humans have now depleted the corners of the galaxy to which they fled. Earth has now become the most valued and precious resource of all, controlled by the corrupt Gaia Coalition which governs the human race across the different galaxies. Having been exiled and vilified during the battle of the Homecoming War, Captain Harlock and his trusted crew of the Arcadia battle cruiser are the only hope mankind has of discovering the secrets that the Gaia have kept hidden. The Coalition has demanded Harlock's death and the Gaia Fleet's new leader, Ezra, calls on his younger brother, Logan, to infiltrate the Arcadia and then assassinate Harlock, thus forever eradicating the one man standing between the Coalition and their complete control of the Universe. Logan must make a very personal sacrifice and discover that things are not always as they seem. All the while Captain Harlock and his crew will continue his mission, seeking revenge against the Coalition and establishing the return to Earth.   Likes : (Animation film ) Well first of all i can't believe this animated film got so many bad reviews, yes  there's a few flaws i noticed, but this was a great film from start to finish. With all animated films you need a good storyline to keep the audience entertain that has an epic adventure feel to it like this one has, as well as the action & intense moments in battle.   The C.G.I cinematographic is amazingly done, The design in making the ship look like a pirate vessel is perfect. I loved that they added the black smoke from the dark matter to give the ship this dreaded dreadnought feel like a ghost ship with the skull & cross bones on the front it kind of adds to the effect of this ship being feared. Special when the ship hyper jumps with the cloud appearing first then you see the ship appear like a death ship from it, it creates awesome entrance for any ship.Voice over acting is brilliantly done to give the characters in the film their own personality's. The character Captain Harlock embodied ll our attempts to act in full autonomy, we are seen as "different" and judged, often condemned. The animated rendering portray this perfect, I will say that this is a potential Digital Masterpiece for an animation film, with a compelling and convincing story-line easy to follow. The job done by the creators is almost perfect. While there are a few plot holes that either weren't explained or weren't explained well enough I think that overall it was balanced well enough to tell the story the director wanted to put across. This is a film worth checking out if you’re into the the Japanese animation.   Dislikes : My only complaints really is that for an English the jumping between Japanese speaking to English at some points which wasn't needed to be honest. There are a few plot holes that i did notice that the lip sinking was slightly off in places but forgivable, apart from that this film was well balanced & entertaining.   Overall : A mysterious vengeful captain. An epic galaxy spanning journey. A fearsome ship. Plenty of action. Family drama Rating: 4.7 out of 5 for entertainment / 8.3 out of 10 for story / animation.
title: Space pirate Captain Harlock (Anime film review)

content: Scampering Panda   *This is a continuation of the highlights of our Friday night stream of Dungeons & Dragons*       The story of the Black Citadel continues as our adventurers bring the now stable yet still unconscious sisters, Tammy and Jenny, to the local inn. The group’s newest member, a 14 year old girl named Ueseigi Sei, who claimed to be from a prominent family, spoke with the innkeeper Connor to set up rooms for the entire group. Devlin found himself once again face to face with a red tiefling with devil horns and a pointy tail as he was greeted by Connor. Already shaken from the previous experience he fled from the inn. The others set up Jenny and Tammy in one of the rooms, and Umber offered to take watch over them. Sei took a room with two beds so she could have Andre as her guard while she slept. Cadence sought her own room at the inn when she bumped into Devlin in the lobby, mustering the courage to interact with Connor. Poor Connor was confused by the half-elf’s apparent distress over his presence. “He has a thing about horns.” Cadence interjects over Devlin’s shoulder. Feeling cornered Devlin requested his room key. “Of course, just a moment.” Connor disappeared behind the counter for a moment. Cadence stayed behind Devlin preventing any escape on his part. “Boo!” Connor jumped out suddenly. To both his and Cadence’s chagrin, Devlin remained unmoved. Keys were given and Cadence and Devlin began to climb the stairs toward their rooms. “Hey, Devlin,” She stopped him part way up the stairs. “Yes?” “I just wanted to apologize for what happened during the last battle. I didn’t mean to scare you. That-that wasn’t me out there.” She stammered before leaving him on the steps in a quandary. Cadence wasn’t alone in her room for long before there was a knock on her door. When she answered she found Connor on the other side. “What’s up with that priest boy?” He inquired. “I really have no idea. He thinks we’re demons.” “Ah,” Connor stroked his beard, “I thought maybe he was just being racist or had some weird horn phobia.” “He’s a priest, what do you expect?” She shrugged. “While I have you here, do you know someone who could identify magical items for me?” Connor proceeds to identify rings of communication and a necklace of tracking that Cadence had pulled from the corpses of Percy’s guards outside of WavesWorld. For the rest of her items she was pointed to the village enchanter. This enchanter confirmed her suspicions that the necklace was indeed used for tracking the wearer, but breaking the enchantment would set off an alarm for the people tracking it. The rings, as well, were useless to the group as there were two or three rings possibly being worn by others in Percy’s employ. With this new information Cadence sought Umber who was still watching the sisters. Immediately after entering the room Cadence slapped Umber across the face. “What was that for?” He exclaimed. “That’s for scaring me!” She then wrapped him into a hug. “I’m glad you’re safe.” “I knew what I was doing.” He replied. “Well, I didn’t. Next time, can you warn me before you jump into random magical light.” “All right.” The two sat down at the table in the room. Cadence asked Umber questions about a previous conversation they’d had when they first met. Umber confirmed once again that he is originally from a WavesWorld from another world. Some great catastrophe happened that wiped his city from existence. The Lawrence of his world found him and brought him through the rift where they met the Lawrence from his world whom Percy had sent the group to find. It was when the two Lawrence’s touched that they disappeared. “Wait, does that mean you’re going back when this is over?” Cadence played with her hair to avoid eye contact. “I don’t think there is anywhere for me to go back to.” Umber answered. After a moment of awkward silence Cadence laid the jewelry out on the table. She told him everything she’d learned from the enchanter about the pieces. Together they agree the rings may be useful if they can manage to collect the missing pieces. However, the necklace is far too dangerous. “What do we do with it? I don’t want to use it here.” Cadence shook her head. “We could throw it into the chasm outside the village. The river should carry it away.” Umber suggested. “That’s a good idea. Let’s do that first thing in the morning.” “Do you mind if I get a nap? Can you watch Tammy and Jenny?”  He asks as a yawn overtook him. Cadence agrees to take the watch as Umber settles into the last available bed in the room. Unfortunately, her constitution failed her; it wasn’t long at all before she passed out at the table. While everyone else slept, Devlin snuck out of the inn stealing away to the forest. Once a decently far away from town so he would not be bothered, he set up a small grave to Asuha who he believed to be killed in the fight that caused so much damage to Tammy. He said a brief prayer for her before returning to his room. The night seemed to pass without incident. Albert woke first and found a note had been slid under his door. Before he finished reading the note he crumpled it and tucked it into his pocket. Devlin woke next and settled into his morning prayers. Sei immediately jumped on Andre after she woke. “Come most trusted bodyguard, let’s go on an adventure!” She commanded, so he obeyed and began preparing to leave the inn. Cadence and Umber were the last to come to consciousness with Umber waking first. The scene that met his eyes was not what he’d been expecting. Cadence was passed out on the table. The mirror in the room had a large hole in the middle with glass all over the floor, and Jenny lay in a pool of blood with her throat slashed. “Cadence! Wake up, Jenny’s been murdered!” Umber shouted at her. “Huh, what?” Cadence snapped awake. She took a minute to take in the room. She noticed the jewelry she’d left on the table. “Umber, the necklace is gone.” “Whoever did this must have taken it. Let me try something.” Touching the hem of her dress, Umber began to tap into his psionic powers that would allow him to see what transpired while they slept. “Stop,” a voice hissed in his head. He ignored the warning and pushed forward. Rather than having his vision opened to the past, his head erupted with splitting pain. Umber collapsed on the ground yelling and clutching his temples. “Umber!” Cadence rushed to his side. Not knowing what was happening she muttered a word of healing over him to no avail. By then both her and Umber’s screams were heard by the rest of the group who appeared shortly in the doorway. Devlin quickly moved beside Cadence to cast lesser restoration on Umber. The pain eased from white hot pain down to an intense throbbing, but Umber still was not quieted. The ruckus woke Tammy who came to investigate the noise. Upon seeing her sister her inquisitive demeanor shifted. “Silence!” She pointed a finger to Umber who immediately felt relief. “What happened? Who was watching over us?” She demanded. No one knew what to say.  “Tell me what happened!” She repeated. “We don’t know. I was watching over you, but I fell asleep. I was trying to find out what happened, but something stopped me.” Umber tried explaining. “Enough,” Tammy held her sister’s lifeless body. Seething with anguish and rage Cadence grabbed the rings off the table and rushed from the room. “Wait, Cadence,” Devlin took off after her. While the others tried to offer condolences before leaving Tammy to grieve alone. Cadence didn’t stop running until she reached the bridge over the chasm on the outskirts of the village. “Cadence, are you all right?” Devlin called to her. “Not now, Devlin,” she snapped, “I need to do this alone, please.” “What are you planning on doing?” “Devlin, please,” She pleaded. “Ok,” reluctantly he returned to the center of town where Albert was sitting next to the pond working on one of his projects. Once she was alone, Cadence put on one of the communication rings and tried to concentrate on connecting with the others. “I don’t know who you are, or what you think you are doing, but you can tell those pieces of shit that you hired that this is not over.” She said not knowing if her message would truly reach its intended recipient. Then, she removed the ring and threw all four of them into the depths of the canyon before collapsing into tears. Being the last to join the group by the pool, Umber approached Devlin. “Where did Cadence go?” Umber asked. “She went outside the village with those rings that were on the table. She said she wanted to be alone. I don’t know what she’s doing there.” Devlin replied. Umber decided to go after her anyway. Finding her on her knees sobbing he sat beside her and wrapped his arm around her. Sei grew impatient with the group’s lack of motivation. She spurred Andre on. “Come, most valued bodyguard, let’s go find the killer or some way to revive her!” She exclaimed merrily. They found Cadence and Umber sitting on the ground by the bridge. “Come, vassels, we are going on an adventure!” Sei commanded. “What?” Umber turned around while Cadence wiped the tears from her face to compose herself. “We’re going to find a soulstone to bring Jenny back.” Sei chirped. “Oh, honey, I don’t think that’s how they work.” Cadence smiled at her optimism. “I want to do some more investigation to see if we can identify the killer.” Umber said as he headed back for the crime scene. So they all returned to the village. Cadence stopped in to speak with Connor before they returned to the room to see if maybe he knew the sisters. The news shook Connor, but he had only ever met Jenny once while she was gathering wheat in the fields. She had been attacked by goblins and he’d come to her aid. Beyond that he knew nothing of the elusive two. They thanked him and the group returned to the room as Sei and Albert bickered over respect. The room was empty. There was no sign of Tammy or Jenny other than the bloody sheet and a note on the table. In the note Tammy explained she had left to put her sister to rest and for the group to, please, not go after her. When she was finished she would be heading to the Vastun to investigate into the disappearance of Percy’s brother and sister and its possible connection to the death of Tristram Octovian, the leader of this part of the Iron Grip. Umber decided to try his psionic investigation on the mirror that faced the room and would give them a clear view of the attacker. This time he was able tap into that night’s events and share what he saw through telepathy with the rest of the party. He saw everything from opening the door for Cadence to her falling asleep at the table. The lights flicker on and off, suddenly all is dark and in the darkness an old man’s face appears. “Not this time,” the face suddenly rushes toward Umber and he is pushed from the vision. Everyone paused not sure of who the stranger was. Together, they decided the best course of action was to enter the forest looking for the strange owl creature who had helped them before. In the forest someone was waiting for them, but it was not the owl creature. Instead, they found the mysterious stranger. “I’ve been waiting for hours.” He growled. Everyone was confused except for Albert who pulled the note from his pocket and actually read it. The mysterious stranger had asked the group to join him in the forest to test their skills. Seeing as they were all gathered he began his attack. The fight that followed was challenging and the young Sei proved to be a strong opponent for the mysterious stranger. After a strong blow from Umber nearly taking him out, the mysterious stranger fled for the time being, but not without leaving gifts for some of the party. The sun had set and the group was tired and wounded from their fight. They decided to return to the village to rest up. They could resume their search for the murderer in the morning. Albert and Devlin went straight to bed while Sei and Andre headed to the bar leaving Cadence and Umber standing in the center of town. “What now?” she sighed. “I could use a hot spring, come on.” Umber headed for the pond. “Huh?” Cadence followed.   The adventure continues Friday night at 9 p.m. EST!
title: Black Citadel Asylum: Murder at the Inn
name: black-citadel-asylum-murder-at-the-inn

Albert and Devlin went straight to bed while Sei and Andre headed to the bar leaving Cadence and Umber standing in the center of town. “What now?” she sighed. “I could use a hot spring, come on.” Umber headed for the pond. “Huh?” Cadence followed.   The adventure continues Friday night at 9 p.m. EST!
title: Black Citadel Asylum: Murder at the Inn
name: 425-revision-v1

content: Hello everyone! My name is Penguingod and I'm the newest addition to the writing team at Laggin’ Out. This is my debut review of the most recent game to the Wolfenstein series, Wolfenstein 2: The New Colossus. I'll be addressing the pros and cons of this release without any spoilers, so none of you reading this have to write me an angry letter of why I'm an asshole for not putting a spoiler warning.      To give a little synopsis of what the franchise is about, the story takes place in an alternate reality where the Nazis won WW2 and have complete global control. They, in-turn, used the atom bomb on the United States in New York and beat the Russians in a cold winter. They became the true victors and global oppressors in this reality that we are glad to not be a part of. The story follows the protagonist, William Joseph Blazkowicz, who once was a soldier in the U.S. Army-turned-freedom fighter and an all American badass, with his ragtag gang of misfits to take on the fascist regime. This particular game is set in 1961 with a struggle that you can easily get behind.        Killing Nazis, fire-breathing robot dogs, and blood-soaked boobs... these are some of my favorite things, and this game has it all. I wanted to start off on the lighter side of things and go with what makes this game cool, flashy, and all that good jive. First, it looks cool; the graphics are clean and the animations for executions and takedowns give a sense of accomplishment after getting your ass handed to you on "Call me Terror-Billy" difficulty (like I did...). Next, the gameplay was very similar to that of DOOM, another Bethesda release with a similar feel of the takedown system and combat speed of being able to run fast at a demon (or in this case, a Nazi) and splitting their head in half and covering your screen in gore. Then come the cinematics, which were the best and my favorite part about this title and where the blood soaked boobs come from. Every cutscene has great significance to the plot and entertainment that this game has to offer. Some will leave you with sympathy, intrigue, or laughing out loud in the middle of your stream so your 30+ viewers have to listen to your witch cackle. Even better, the graphics for the scenes are beautifully done and add depth to the plot with great storytelling. The last pro that really stood out to me was the story. It was filled with great twists and turns that left you with a hell of a cliffhanger and a killer ending. It even plays in favor of the antagonist at parts, too, and gives a gripping turn of events completely throughout the experience of this game.         On the other hand, FUCK THIS GAME! The cons of this game left me saltier than a 12 year old who switches to Bastion on defense Temple of Anubis after a terrible attack in an Overwatch competitive match. The difficulty was not very balanced, considering I played on the third hardest difficulty and I still got my ass whooped like I was McGregor. I actually had to check and see if I was playing Dark Souls or not. Also, the A.I. was a little jank, because when the enemy is shooting in your general direction, NOT EVEN HITTING YOU WITH THEIR SHOTS, and you still take bullet damage, it implies that something is up with the coding or that the developers just got lazy. Which leads to my next thing, Bethesda. You’ve gotta know that if their hands are in it, then you know it will have problems with the release and this is nothing shy of that fact. Glitches and crashes happen for no apparent reason, as well as a corrupted save while I was still playing the game that left me with the game closing itself out multiple times and angrily throwing my controller. The thing is I had the same thing happen with the other two titles and is the reason why I have yet to play them, so when my game crashed for virtually the same thing, it left me red. Luckily, I was able to pull up another save so I didn't have too much lost time. Lastly, they wanted you to focus on sneaking, but that became a joke when the enemy would just automatically know you are sitting behind a crate over there, playing with your gameboy, minding your own business, thus having them send an entire army of dickheads at you, and no I'm not talking about the shape of their helmets either.     When it comes down to it though, I enjoyed the hell out of the game and can't wait to get into all the side missions and getting all of the extra things to collect in the game. I actually like how you can continue playing your campaign save, even after you beat the main story, with plenty of extra side missions to do if you arelike me and didn't do them during said story. My score for the game is a solid 8/10 (which would have been a 10/10 if I wasn't so triggered about the things prior mentioned). If you don't feel like spending the $60 price for a copy of this title, at least find a video that gives a show of all the cutscenes, I promise you won't regret it. Well, that's it for this review. I hope you all enjoyed it and found it somewhat helpful in the final decision to purchase this game because it's definitely worth the experience. Till next time, this is Penguin, sliding off the ice.
title: Wolfenstein 2: The New Colossus Review

content: Movie Knights Story: Fueled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman's selfless act, Bruce Wayne enlists the help of his newfound ally, Diana Prince, to face an even greater enemy. Together, Batman and Wonder Woman work quickly to find and recruit a team of metahumans to stand against this newly awakened threat. But, despite the formation of this unprecedented league of heroes- Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg, and The Flash- it may already be too late to save the planet from an assault of catastrophic proportions. Likes : Please don't judge me like the Hollywood critics. I have to honestly say this is the first time- even though it pains me- I have to agree with the Hollywood critics on this DC film because of two factors: Warner Bros. CEO, Kevin Tsujihara, demanding that the film be 2 hours; and Joss Whedon, which I will explain in the dislikes.   After explaining this, is the film really that bad? ...Mmmmm no- there are parts of this film that Snyder actually got right. The Flash's character was also played brilliantly by Ezra Miller- I know a lot of people were worried about him and the suit, but it does explain in the film the pseudo-science,  as well as where this version of the Flash is in his life (SPOILER ALERT:  he hasn't met his mother’s killer yet, which we all know is Reverse Flash)   Jason Momoa pretty much made Aquaman badass again, giving us a lone wolf character that hasn't fully embraced his Atlantean destiny yet, and from what we’ve been told, this won't happen until the solo film. Although Mamoa brings a badass character to the big screen, he did give a funny moment: a hilarious threat to the Flash which I laughed at.   With Cyborg, this was actually tastefully done in showing a character that lost who he was and trying to come to terms with being a cyborg while still remaining human, which gave the character a human side instead of just a machine.   The way Superman was brought back in the film was ingenious and they handled it brilliantly because if someone died and was resurrected, they wouldn't be the same. Those were pretty intense moments which actually connect the scenes of BvS with the nightmare scenes. If Batman hadn’t done what he did, things would have gone differently.   Visually, the film is stunning. Although there is a problem with the concept, which I will explain later, the build up of the film is great, with Steppenwolf being the villain. The big battle scene from the trailers was a flashback story showing the first battle and background of Steppenwolf. The deities Zeus, Athena with the Bow of Orion, and Ares- although brief- cameoed in the very brief battle.   The Flash’s running effects were amazingly done. The cinematography was better than Quicksilver’s slow motion scenes in X-Men: Apocalypse. I agree that this film is great- some areas were well made- but sadly, there are areas of this film where I agree with Hollywood critics.      Dislikes : The tone of the film lacks substance, much like Marvel films. Joss Whedon’s attempt to make it a little lighter resulted in the film lacking substance. I think Joss was a mistake to bring on. I hope DC and Warner Bros. see this because he is not the right director to be doing DC films. Sorry Joss- you're a good director, but this film lost its soul.     The main problem this film had was the 2 hour show time. Even I could see this. It needed an extra 40 to 50 minutes to flow better.The 2 hours that the CEO of Warners Bros. demanded was a let down.   If this film had a been bit longer, Superman’s scenes and the ending fight wouldn’t have felt flat. Steppenwolf's character felt like he had been nerfed down a little; the fight felt a little too easy and had no dramatic feel to it. The big bad boss should've been at the end when Steppenwolf was losing; this would have saved the film and given a better fight for Superman.     If I could describe this film in a few words, it felt more like bad sex- great build up with a poor finish.   If you have seen this film already, what did you think? Do you agree with what I said, or do you have your own opinion? Let us know in the comments. Overall : Great film, brilliant visual effects, felt like it could've been better. Rating: 5 out of 5 for Entertainment / 8 out of 10 for overall concept, could've been a 10
title: Justice League Film Review
name: justice-league-film-review

content: -Penguingod        Woo hoo! It’s the best time of the year! Penguin here with Black Friday deals for the Xbox store. There are some great deals with over 400 games on sale at up to 65% off on select titles. I will be throwing at you the key deals and must haves to complete your game collection, but if you would like a full list, it can be seen at Xbox.com for more details.     Starting things off right we’ve got Wolfenstein 2: The New Order and The Evil Within 2 at $35.99, which were two of my favorites this year and are essential for gamers into gore games. If you have yet to play The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, the complete edition is only $25.00, with its expansions also being on sale with varied prices, which is quite the steal.     Halo Wars 2 came out earlier this year and it’s on sale right now for $23.99 with the complete edition at $56.99. Its prequel is on sale as well for $11.99. Destiny 2’s deluxe edition is on sale for $82.99 which comes with the expansion pass and extra goodies, but if you want just the base game, it’s only $44.99. The crowd favorite Overwatch is on sale for a whopping $35.99, which that title has yet to drop in price since it has released.     Call of Duty: WWII managed to make the ballot, but only the digital deluxe edition with the price of $94.99, which isn’t much of a deal but some might find use in it. Assassin’s Creed: Origins is setting down to $41.99. Final Fantasy XV is going on for only $20.00, too.     Now for games I’m interested in picking up myself, South Park: The Fractured But Whole is on sale for $40.19. The Dark Souls games are on sale with the second installment landing at $16.00 and the deluxe edition for the third being at $34.00, which is not a bad deal at all. Lastly, Life is Strange: Before the Storm is at $17.49.     These deals and many more make up for a damn good Black Friday sale this year. It is definitely worth looking into, including the Xbox 360 games that are on sale that you can play backwards compatible with your Xbox One. Well that’s it for this one ladies and gents; till next time, this is Penguin, sliding off the ice.
