title: "Suicide Squad" - European Premiere - Red Carpet Arrivals
excerpt: LONDON, ENGLAND - AUGUST 03: Deborah Snyder and Zack Snyder attend the European Premiere of "Suicide Squad" at the Odeon Leicester Square on August 3, 2016 in London, England. (Photo by Chris Jackson/Getty Images)
name: suicide-squad-european-premiere-red-carpet-arrivals

content:
Written By Movie Knights Warner Bros. has stooped to a whole new level, as a media outlet called "The Wrap", found out some information on Warner Bros. concerning the Justice League film. This just shows how much Warner Bros. doesn't give a damn about the franchise, but here is what was said:   “Warner Bros. execs put out a bad movie on purpose for a quick payday,”   Timeline to explain -  
  • After the Batman trilogy, Warner Bros. wanted Chris Nolan to do Superman, but Nolan said no and instead pushed for Zack Snyder, (a family friend).
 
  • During Man of steel and Batman v Superman (BvS), Warner Bros. execs didn't even read Snyder’s notes on the films...instead just trusted him.
 
  • The president and CEO of Warner Bros. Kevin Tsujihara hated BvS so much that they wanted to fire Snyder from Justice league, but it was set to begin filming the following week so they kept him on and sent in a babysitter to oversee everything.
 
  • Warner Bros. hated the direction Justice League was going and kept trying to get Snyder to change things, which he would have, but it was difficult and stressful for him to do so.
 
  • Snyder was about to quit or get fired when the tragedy of his daughter happened with his family. He chose to get lost in the work and go all in to separate himself from the tragedy, thus making it worse.
 
  • Huge pressure from Warner Bros. execs at this point, who were understanding of what Snyder was facing in real life, were very against the movie. They called it a Frankenstein movie and said it was incoherent, made no sense, and was way too dark.
[caption id="attachment_530" align="alignnone" width="1024"] LONDON, ENGLAND - AUGUST 03: Deborah Snyder and Zack Snyder attend the European Premiere of "Suicide Squad" at the Odeon Leicester Square on August 3, 2016 in London, England. (Photo by Chris Jackson/Getty Images)
[/caption]
  • Snyder left the film to be with his family.
   
  • So instead of Warner Bros. delaying the movie until 2018, the president and CEO decided to bring in another director and throw another 100 million studio money for re-shoots and for a quick turn around (this includes things like the infamous CGI over Superman's lips being done poorly), because they didn't have time or resources to keep the release date of 2017. The release of 2017 would mean they get their bonus checks for the year.
 
  • They both were sure they wouldn't have a job in 2018 so they released the film, knowing the film was in a poor state for the sake of a bonus check. Warner Bros. execs made a conscious decision to release a poor product which they acknowledged would be worse than bonus money.
  What actually pisses me off more is the fact that they are shifting the blame to Snyder knowing it was their own fault. They knew about it, but more disgustingly, in screwing fans over and ruining one of the most important films in the DC universe over a bonus check. I am not impressed with Warner Bros.
title: Warner Bros. Have Clearly Failed DC Fans
name: 511-revision-v1

content: Tardis2238    Well, 2017 is almost over, and as I’m writing this I can’t help but think that this was one of the best years for us gamers, so here are my Top 10 games of 2017.                10.The Evil Within 2  A lot of people were worried about this game because of the disappointment of the previous title. I however, very much enjoyed the first game, so I knew I’d be getting this one. They have learned about what didn’t work in the last game and have sharpened everything to a point. The atmosphere, the enemy design, the story, it’s all so great and is definitely my horror game of the year.           9.Hellblade: Senua’s Sacrifice  If I were to give this game an award it would definitely be in sound design. The way it really makes you feel like your hearing voices when wearing headphones is chilling. I also consulted someone I know who has mental illness and they said it was extremely accurate in its portrayal.            8.Xenoblade Chronicles 2  This game really surprised me on how good it is, having never played the first game I was a little skeptical on buying it, but after almost 50 hours of play, I’m happy to say it was a good buy. I loved so much about this game, but if I have to criticize it, the combat isn’t that much fun, being an auto attack system, even so I still really enjoyed it and I think you will too.                    7.Nier Automata  With the combat of Bayonetta and the great ideas of the first Nier, this game is one of those games you may not have heard of. You play as an android named 2B, who must defend Earth from machines bent on the destruction of Humanity. This game isn’t afraid to try out weird things and that’s pretty rare in today’s gaming world. In short, if you haven’t played it yet you owe it to yourself to get this game.            6.Assassins Creed Origins  While the combat is slightly lacking in this game, the story, world building, and stealth system is top notch. I was very nervous about this game, what with the series recently bad games. Luckily the game was just plain fantastic and gripping. Egypt is beautiful and mysterious, seeing the beginning of the Assassin brotherhood was just incredible.                             5.Injustice 2  Being a huge comic book nerd, this was an easy decision for this list, (also because you can play as Green Arrow). Seeing characters like Wonder Woman and Superman fight each other is a comic book fans greatest fantasy. Not only that, but NetherRealm Studios keeps adding new characters so there’s more and more fighting combos to see.        4.The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild  This game really showed everyone that Nintendo is still a force to be reckoned with. Being a Zelda game, it had a lot to live up to and I’d say it delivered on all fronts. Being able to Shield surf, cook, complete puzzles, and of course, save a princess. This game came out nine months ago and there’s so many things to do that you may still be playing this game. There’s a reason it won game of the year after all.                3.Horizon Zero Dawn  Now you may be wondering what made me pick this game over Breath of the Wild. Well in my opinion the story, the world, and the characters are of a much higher quality. It has a strong leading woman and the world and the lore is just amazing to explore and unravel. Not to mention Guerrilla Games only made shooters before this gem was born.              2.Super Mario Odyssey  This may be the best game on the Nintendo Switch. The level design is perfect, the enemy variety and powers are amazing. The graphics are extremely well done for a Nintendo game. This game had me glued to it for days, the only reason it’s not perfect is it’s a little short and easy.                      1.Persona 5  I’m just gonna say it, not only is this my game of the year it’s also my favorite game ever as well as the most stylish game ever. Atlus out did themselves with this. Everything is amazing about this game. The story is phenomenal, being about standing up to crappy adults who rule the world. This is my game of the year.   So how’d I do? Did I miss any games? If so leave a comment.
title: Tardis2238’s Top 10 Games of 2017
name: tardis2238s-top-10-games-of-2017

content: —written by Penguingod         Hey everyone, so I was thinking... I know, right? Me? Thinking? So I thought about all the different things people like to do in tradition of their time while gaming, how some people will look up things on their phones, paint their nails, or sacrifice a goat before a match, (my personal favorite).     One in particular is listening to music, which aside from the goat sacrifices, is another favorite pastime or distraction of the daily game grind that I like to partake. I for one, am a person who can appreciate or listen to all types of music, (except country or pop because I hate that shit). I like to pick certain different genres of music depending on my mood and type of the game that I am playing. Certain games go hand in hand with music and they can complement each other in ways to make some of the most memorable fun people can have, which I for one can hear a song and remember a particular scene I was doing in a game (kudos to fond memories).     Games and music I like to correlate like a fashionista and their wardrobe. When I play a racing game such as Forza Motorsports, I like music that is high energy. Such as my top picks for this would be “Punk Rock”. I even thank Forza 3 and all of the countless hours I put into it to find my favorite band The Offspring, even though the newer Forza games suck now, it was a great series to get lost in. Games with fast paced combat like Gears of War I like to listen to “Metal” or some “thuggin’ ass gangsta rap”. I even made an all metal playlist for Gears 3 that had bands like All That Remains, Bullet For My Valentine, and Lamb Of God. On the other hand lately when I feel like ripping my eyes out due to sheer anger, I listen to YG or older Ice Cube. Then comes the games that use creativity or imagination. Minecraft or even Portal would go well with some “Trance” or “House” genres. The smooth beats and chilled vibes opens up your mind and helps the creative juices flow like the blood of my enemies on a warm summer night. Dj Mangoo, who is my favorite trance artist, holds some of my favorite music to listen to while mining for countless hours, only to get side tracked by another project and never finishing what I had started.     Now comes the obscure genres or very specific types that I like to put together. Overwatch for instance, I can’t get enough of The Weeknd (boy does he know how to get into my pants too). Nothing is better than dishing out some healing beats to “Starboy” or going “High Noon” to “The Reminder”, cause I gotta remind fools what time it is, (see what I did there? No? Damn). Now here is the really obscure one, Battlefield 1 (specifically) and “Reggae” music. Now I don’t know why but one day I put on the reggae station on Pandora while I jumped on and let me tell you the stoner vibe of some Rastafarian dude talking about peace counteracts the non-peaceful game that is about nothing but war. Ironic, right? Try bombing people to “One Love” while in a biplane or riding horseback, slaying noobs to “Red Wine”, and hopefully you see what I mean, or you will think I’m an idiot for combining those two together cause I’m not even sure how I do it myself.     Memories are a huge part of my gaming and music history. When I hear a song that I remember listening to while playing a game, I’ll have nostalgic flashbacks of that one moment and what I was doing in that game. A lot of the times when I listen to Green Day’s “Dookie” or “Insomniac” albums, it reminds me of playing Forza 3, as stated before, and racing on “Road America”. When I hear songs from the band Poison, I remember doing taxi missions in GTA: Vice City, or if I hear “Stranglehold” by Ted Nugent or “Breaking the Chains” by Dokken, it brings me back to GTA: Vice City Stories on the PSP. A lot of time was also spent, playing Battlefield 3, and listening to Fall Out Boy’s “From Under The Cork Tree”, playing “Scavenger”, and talking music with good friends, having good times. Making these memories have been a staple in my gaming history and made times I will never forget.     I’ve always seen these two entertainment outlets as things that can go hand in hand like two lovers walking along a beach with a nuclear bomb detonating in the background. Whether you are remembering old memories or making new ones, if you are listening to your favorite artist or trying out a new genre entirely while blasting the opposition; music and videogames are two beautiful things that have been given to us to escape the society that we as a common folk have been thrusted into.     If you are like me and enjoy listening to music while gaming then I salute you, and if you read this and decide to give it a try then hats off to you! If you have any more that you would like to share or any memories you’d like to talk about, then send me a message on the Laggin’ Out web page and I’ll feature it in a follow-up article. Well everyone that’s it for this one, this is Penguin slidin’ off the ice.
title: Music and Gaming: Symphonies and Virtual Realities
name: 517-revision-v1

content: Written by Penguingod     “1 batch, 2 batch, penny and dime.” When I hear that line, it sends shivers down my spine. Penguin here with a review for a Netflix series that is worth watching for all action fans out there, comic book or not. The series in question was long awaited and sought out after Daredevil: season 2. I of course, am talking about Marvel’s The Punisher. This apple pie of the “Netflix originals” is one hell of a ride that Marvel fans can really appreciate.     That being said, one thing I really like as well as most comic book nerds will like about this series is how well they do justice to the comics. They play well with adding characters straight from the books, like Microchip, who in the books was a hacker that helped Frank Castle (The Punisher for you noobs who don’t know). They bring in Billy Russo aka Jigsaw as the old best friend to Frank, which wasn’t completely true to the comics but they played it nicely with this series. There are other characters too that are straight out of the books that I won’t mention because it takes away from the fun of the show.     Jon Bernthal does complete justice for the character of Frank. I’d say that he has been the best Punisher, even though I enjoyed Thomas Jane’s portrayal of the same role in the 2004 Punisher movie. There is one thing that I did not care for with his acting, it’s the way he looks around so much when he talks in a dialogue with another character. I’m sure that it is his acting style, because it was seen a lot when he played Shane in AMC’s The Walking Dead, but it makes him look like he has social anxiety, which is not how  the Punisher should be. He does however, do well with his serious tone and acting out action scenes so the negative can be overlooked.     I love the action, it being the best part about the show. They made it gritty and gore filled, with lots of blood. They did not hold back in this show which I was skeptical at first, it being a Netflix series and all. They have plenty of fun filled action for any buff of that cinematic genre. The story is a great thrill ride, going from being a steady incline in plot, building up to the last 4 episodes, then shooting to the stars, leading to a hell of a showdown in the very last episode.     Apart from the mention of before, I enjoyed everyone’s acting. Ben Barnes played his part well as Billy, making him into an arrogant playboy esque villain. Deborah Ann Woll revises her roll as Karen Page, who is a re-occurring character in the Marvel Netflix series, and comes back with her “no bullshit” attitude. Ebon Moss-Bachrach, legs intact, played a great nerdy, computer hacker sidekick that was needed for the Punisher’s arsenal, along with a ton of guns. His role as Microchip was quite detrimental to the show’s plot and he played it well.     This pseudo television series is quite enjoyable and is perfect for comic book nerds and fans of the action genre. It’s definitely worth the watch and I am sure you will enjoy it like I did; 9.5/10 for a great piece of work that plays well into the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Well everyone, that’s it for this one, this is Penguin, slidin off the ice.
title: Netflix’s New Golden Child: Marvel’s The Punisher
name: 514-revision-v1

In short, if you haven’t played it yet you owe it to yourself to get this game.            6.Assassins Creed Origins  While the combat is slightly lacking in this game, the story, world building, and stealth system is top notch. I was very nervous about this game, what with the series recently bad games. Luckily the game was just plain fantastic and gripping. Egypt is beautiful and mysterious, seeing the beginning of the Assassin brotherhood was just incredible.                             5.Injustice 2  Being a huge comic book nerd, this was an easy decision for this list, (also because you can play as Green Arrow). Seeing characters like Wonder Woman and Superman fight each other is a comic book fans greatest fantasy. Not only that, but NetherRealm Studios keeps adding new characters so there’s more and more fighting combos to see.        4.The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild  This game really showed everyone that Nintendo is still a force to be reckoned with. Being a Zelda game, it had a lot to live up to and I’d say it delivered on all fronts. Being able to Shield surf, cook, complete puzzles, and of course, save a princess. This game came out nine months ago and there’s so many things to do that you may still be playing this game. There’s a reason it won game of the year after all.                3.Horizon Zero Dawn  Now you may be wondering what made me pick this game over Breath of the Wild. Well in my opinion the story, the world, and the characters are of a much higher quality. It has a strong leading woman and the world and the lore is just amazing to explore and unravel. Not to mention Guerrilla Games only made shooters before this gem was born.              2.Super Mario Odyssey  This may be the best game on the Nintendo Switch. The level design is perfect, the enemy variety and powers are amazing. The graphics are extremely well done for a Nintendo game. This game had me glued to it for days, the only reason it’s not perfect is it’s a little short and easy.                      1.Persona 5  I’m just gonna say it, not only is this my game of the year it’s also my favorite game ever as well as the most stylish game ever. Atlus out did themselves with this. Everything is amazing about this game. The story is phenomenal, being about standing up to crappy adults who rule the world. This is my game of the year.   So how’d I do? Did I miss any games? If so leave a comment.
title: Tardis2238’s Top 10 Games of 2017
name: 537-revision-v1

content:
Written By Movie Knights Warner Bros. has stooped to a whole new level, as a media outlet called "The Wrap", found out some information on Warner Bros. concerning the Justice League film. This just shows how much Warner Bros. doesn't give a damn about the franchise, but here is what was said:   “Warner Bros. execs put out a bad movie on purpose for a quick payday,”   Timeline to explain -    
  • After the Batman trilogy, Warner Bros. wanted Chris Nolan to do Superman, but Nolan said no and instead pushed for Zack Snyder, (a family friend).
 
  • During Man of steel and Batman v Superman (BvS), Warner Bros. execs didn't even read Snyder’s notes on the films...instead just trusted him. 
 
  • The president and CEO of Warner Bros. Kevin Tsujihara hated BvS so much that they wanted to fire Snyder from Justice league, but it was set to begin filming the following week so they kept him on and sent in a babysitter to oversee everything.
 
  • Warner Bros. hated the direction Justice League was going and kept trying to get Snyder to change things, which he would have, but it was difficult and stressful for him to do so.
 
  • Snyder was about to quit or get fired when the tragedy of his daughter happened with his family. He chose to get lost in the work and go all in to separate himself from the tragedy, thus making it worse.
 
  • Huge pressure from Warner Bros. execs at this point, who were understanding of what Snyder was facing in real life, were very against the movie. They called it a Frankenstein movie and said it was incoherent, made no sense, and was way too dark. 
[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1024"] LONDON, ENGLAND - AUGUST 03: Deborah Snyder and Zack Snyder attend the European Premiere of "Suicide Squad" at the Odeon Leicester Square on August 3, 2016 in London, England. (Photo by Chris Jackson/Getty Images)[/caption]  
  • Snyder left the film to be with his family.
   
  • So instead of Warner Bros. delaying the movie until 2018, the president and CEO decided to bring in another director and throw another 100 million studio money for re-shoots and for a quick turn around (this includes things like the infamous CGI over Superman's lips being done poorly), because they didn't have time or resources to keep the release date of 2017. The release of 2017 would mean they get their bonus checks for the year.
 
  • They both were sure they wouldn't have a job in 2018 so they released the film, knowing the film was in a poor state for the sake of a bonus check. Warner Bros. execs made a conscious decision to release a poor product which they acknowledged would be worse than bonus money. 
  What actually pisses me off more is the fact that they are shifting the blame to Snyder knowing it was their own fault. They knew about it, but more disgustingly, in screwing fans over and ruining one of the most important films in the DC universe over a bonus check. I am not impressed with Warner Bros.
title: Warner Bros. Have Clearly Failed DC Fans
name: 511-revision-v1

content: Written by Penguingod     “1 batch, 2 batch, penny and dime.” When I hear that line, it sends shivers down my spine. Penguin here with a review for a Netflix series that is worth watching for all action fans out there, comic book or not. The series in question was long awaited and sought out after Daredevil: season 2. I of course, am talking about Marvel’s The Punisher. This apple pie of the “Netflix originals” is one hell of a ride that Marvel fans can really appreciate.     That being said, one thing I really like as well as most comic book nerds will like about this series is how well they do justice to the comics. They play well with adding characters straight from the books, like Microchip, who in the books was a hacker that helped Frank Castle (The Punisher for you noobs who don’t know). They bring in Billy Russo aka Jigsaw as the old best friend to Frank, which wasn’t completely true to the comics but they played it nicely with this series. There are other characters too that are straight out of the books that I won’t mention because it takes away from the fun of the show.     Jon Bernthal does complete justice for the character of Frank. I’d say that he has been the best Punisher, even though I enjoyed Thomas Jane’s portrayal of the same role in the 2004 Punisher movie. There is one thing that I did not care for with his acting, it’s the way he looks around so much when he talks in a dialogue with another character. I’m sure that it is his acting style, because it was seen a lot when he played Shane in AMC’s The Walking Dead, but it makes him look like he has social anxiety, which is not how  the Punisher should be. He does however, do well with his serious tone and acting out action scenes so the negative can be overlooked.     I love the action, it being the best part about the show. They made it gritty and gore filled, with lots of blood. They did not hold back in this show which I was skeptical at first, it being a Netflix series and all. They have plenty of fun filled action for any buff of that cinematic genre. The story is a great thrill ride, going from being a steady incline in plot, building up to the last 4 episodes, then shooting to the stars, leading to a hell of a showdown in the very last episode.     Apart from the mention of before, I enjoyed everyone’s acting. Ben Barnes played his part well as Billy, making him into an arrogant playboy esque villain. Deborah Ann Woll revises her roll as Karen Page, who is a re-occurring character in the Marvel Netflix series, and comes back with her “no bullshit” attitude. Ebon Moss-Bachrach, legs intact, played a great nerdy, computer hacker sidekick that was needed for the Punisher’s arsenal, along with a ton of guns. His role as Microchip was quite detrimental to the show’s plot and he played it well.     This pseudo television series is quite enjoyable and is perfect for comic book nerds and fans of the action genre. It’s definitely worth the watch and I am sure you will enjoy it like I did; 9.5/10 for a great piece of work that plays well into the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Well everyone, that’s it for this one, this is Penguin, slidin off the ice.
title: Netflix’s New Golden Child: Marvel’s The Punisher
name: 514-revision-v1

content: —written by Penguingod         Hey everyone, so I was thinking... I know, right? Me? Thinking? So I thought about all the different things people like to do in tradition of their time while gaming, how some people will look up things on their phones, paint their nails, or sacrifice a goat before a match, (my personal favorite).     One in particular is listening to music, which aside from the goat sacrifices, is another favorite pastime or distraction of the daily game grind that I like to partake. I for one, am a person who can appreciate or listen to all types of music, (except country or pop because I hate that shit). I like to pick certain different genres of music depending on my mood and type of the game that I am playing. Certain games go hand in hand with music and they can complement each other in ways to make some of the most memorable fun people can have, which I for one can hear a song and remember a particular scene I was doing in a game (kudos to fond memories).     Games and music I like to correlate like a fashionista and their wardrobe. When I play a racing game such as Forza Motorsports, I like music that is high energy. Such as my top picks for this would be “Punk Rock”. I even thank Forza 3 and all of the countless hours I put into it to find my favorite band The Offspring, even though the newer Forza games suck now, it was a great series to get lost in. Games with fast paced combat like Gears of War I like to listen to “Metal” or some “thuggin’ ass gangsta rap”. I even made an all metal playlist for Gears 3 that had bands like All That Remains, Bullet For My Valentine, and Lamb Of God. On the other hand lately when I feel like ripping my eyes out due to sheer anger, I listen to YG or older Ice Cube. Then comes the games that use creativity or imagination. Minecraft or even Portal would go well with some “Trance” or “House” genres. The smooth beats and chilled vibes opens up your mind and helps the creative juices flow like the blood of my enemies on a warm summer night. Dj Mangoo, who is my favorite trance artist, holds some of my favorite music to listen to while mining for countless hours, only to get side tracked by another project and never finishing what I had started.     Now comes the obscure genres or very specific types that I like to put together. Overwatch for instance, I can’t get enough of The Weeknd (boy does he know how to get into my pants too). Nothing is better than dishing out some healing beats to “Starboy” or going “High Noon” to “The Reminder”, cause I gotta remind fools what time it is, (see what I did there? No? Damn). Now here is the really obscure one, Battlefield 1 (specifically) and “Reggae” music. Now I don’t know why but one day I put on the reggae station on Pandora while I jumped on and let me tell you the stoner vibe of some Rastafarian dude talking about peace counteracts the non-peaceful game that is about nothing but war. Ironic, right? Try bombing people to “One Love” while in a biplane or riding horseback, slaying noobs to “Red Wine”, and hopefully you see what I mean, or you will think I’m an idiot for combining those two together cause I’m not even sure how I do it myself.     Memories are a huge part of my gaming and music history. When I hear a song that I remember listening to while playing a game, I’ll have nostalgic flashbacks of that one moment and what I was doing in that game. A lot of the times when I listen to Green Day’s “Dookie” or “Insomniac” albums, it reminds me of playing Forza 3, as stated before, and racing on “Road America”. When I hear songs from the band Poison, I remember doing taxi missions in GTA: Vice City, or if I hear “Stranglehold” by Ted Nugent or “Breaking the Chains” by Dokken, it brings me back to GTA: Vice City Stories on the PSP. A lot of time was also spent, playing Battlefield 3, and listening to Fall Out Boy’s “From Under The Cork Tree”, playing “Scavenger”, and talking music with good friends, having good times. Making these memories have been a staple in my gaming history and made times I will never forget.     I’ve always seen these two entertainment outlets as things that can go hand in hand like two lovers walking along a beach with a nuclear bomb detonating in the background. Whether you are remembering old memories or making new ones, if you are listening to your favorite artist or trying out a new genre entirely while blasting the opposition; music and videogames are two beautiful things that have been given to us to escape the society that we as a common folk have been thrusted into.     If you are like me and enjoy listening to music while gaming then I salute you, and if you read this and decide to give it a try then hats off to you! If you have any more that you would like to share or any memories you’d like to talk about, then send me a message on the Laggin’ Out web page and I’ll feature it in a follow-up article. Well everyone that’s it for this one, this is Penguin slidin’ off the ice.
title: Music and Gaming: Symphonies and Virtual Realities
name: 517-revision-v1

content: Tardis2238            When the Nintendo Switch was announced, a lot of people weren’t impressed because of the failure of the Wii U. Everyone had doubts about shelling out a bunch of money for a Nintendo system that had been preceded by a dud. Nintendo responded in the best way possible by making The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, a game that proves Nintendo is back in the race. The Golden Joystick Awards must agree since they voted on this game to receive 4 awards including Ultimate Game of the Year.       You play as Link, who has been asleep for 100 years after failing to stop Calamity Ganon, now he must find some way to stop Ganon and save not only Zelda, but Hyrule itself.       The combat is pretty solid as usual, but slightly stressful because most weapons have durability which means they can break mid-battle. Because of this, and the strength of certain enemies you never really feel like your in control, making this a very stressful adventure.       The land of Hyrule is vast and varied; there are sections of the world with lava, forest, water, mountains, etc. Being the first open world Zelda game you will even explore old set pieces from Ocarina of Time.     I’ve become a bit of a Zelda connoisseur so I was a little worried about this game because of all the changes it was making, but I’m happy to say this game is really something special. I give this little gem a 9.1/10.
title: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild: A Breath of Fresh Air
name: 493-revision-v1

content: Written By Movie Knights   Let's be honest here before you start jumping down my throat saying i'm just another hater of this film. Which yes, i know a lot of people who think this is a masterpiece, but i don't think these people even know what a masterpiece is these days.   This isn’t an article to hate on the film, as it's an article to point out why i feel this film is a sloppy mess, despite some parts of the film being good. Sadly there’s a lot of problems with this film, which is the reason for the box office slump. So let's look at what went wrong and what they got right.   Superman’s character without a doubt. Henry Cavill, was the perfect casting choice for Superman due to his nature as a person and as an actor, you can't deny that. From Man of Steel, Batman v Superman, and now Justice League, he's proven that very thing. With Justice League it was a bold move on how they brought him back with one of the “Mother Boxes”, which was done right on screen with him not knowing who he was or where he was since he's been dead for months, and it works. The other things addressed which worked was the moment Superman attacked, clearly not knowing who they were, when Flash tried to come up from behind him. It was this point that was good for Superman because even though the Flash is faster than light, Superman has supervision as we saw in Man of steel when he could see the ship in orbit.   Also, addressed the nightmare scene as well, where Lois being the key, if she had died at any point before his resurrection, they wouldn't of been able to anchor Kal El, and he would have join Steppenwolf, so this is clearly put in there. What went wrong?   I think the biggest somewhat of a “disappointment” but easily forgivable, with this film is that they didn't really keep to the comics, when it came to the event of Batman v Superman to which i mean the death of Superman. Here is where they had the opportunity to bring him back with the iconic black and silver suit, not that it needed it, but still they missed that Opportunity here. The other fact was because of the film only being 2 hrs long, it made Superman’s recovery time too fast. Sadly this is a big flaw in the film’s story, even for a kryptonian, that was way too too fast. The way he was written to be brought back wasn't even close to how he originally came back, but i’m guessing it was changed for the film. The Flash's character, not sure if it was rewrites or re-shoots, but the character of Barry Allen was all wrong. It’s because of the casting, Ezra Miller being a brilliant actor, is just the way he was written in. The running at high speed was perfect because if you look at an ice speed skater, you recognize the movement which is attention to detail, plus the suit design is perfect because it's designed from the specs of NASA’s shuttle with heat resistant and electricity interference, which is explained in the film.   What else is wrong is the way they made Flash, this kid in a sweet shop, acting like a weird kid with a witty humor. This isn't Barry: he’s more straight going and a little reserved. Wally West is the wise cracking speedster, however Barry is not. The reason why i say this is you have to look at his life, his mom was killed in front of him and his dad is accused of this murder and put in jail. Barry realistically wouldn't be the way he is portrayed in Justice League, which is another flaw in the story. Wonder woman’s character I can't help but think they held her back in this film as she is the most experienced fighter there. This film does somehow hold her back. I did notice this especially when she was facing Steppenwolf, it’s like they slightly nerfed her a little. Apart from that, Gal Gadot is without a doubt the best casting choice for this character.   With the Aquaman and Cyborg characters, they were done pretty well, giving more depth to their characters, all though i do feel these characters we're under used in the film in areas. Yeah, there’s not a lot Aquaman can do on land because his powers are connected with the sea and water, but we do get some scenes where he has some funny moments. With Cyborg I felt some emotion, but not a whole bunch. I think a lot of his scenes were cut, which would have given his character more depth.   Here is where the film goes completely wrong! It's not the visual effects, although a few Superman close-ups with a C.G.I makeover to get rid of that mustache  only because of paramount’s contract with Henry Cavill still filming at the time he couldn’t remove it, but the end result seriously looked bad on screen and should've been done right.   Plus the other reason for the film’s failure isn’t the critics or the fans trash talking the film, let's be honest here, it's the film itself that’s at fault.   The biggest problem this film had was the 2hrs time limit forced on the film by CEO Kevin Tsujihara, demanding the film to be said length. This completely made the film of this size feel rushed, which did not give the film any time for the characters to develop, which I explained with Superman as well. This i can’t emphasize enough, the Light tone only works if you have characters that need a light tone in certain scenes for humor. However, no matter what people say, a film being completely light toned is you’re turning the whole film into a toned down comedy or child's film which kills any villains presence being menacing. Which is whats happened here with the Justice League and why it wasn’t booming in box office sales. Sadly, it’s nothing to do with critics or the fans, but the film itself, even though i gave this an 8 out of 10 in my review, this film was ruined by this very thing. By cutting most of Snyder’s scenes for the Joss Weldon reshoot and rewrites, they compromised the film’s integrity, leaving it with no substance.   What I mean by that is that Man of Steel was a masterpiece because of its grittIer tone, BvS is a misunderstood masterpiece in its story alone, Suicide Squad was not so much but Wonder Woman was the first step in the right direction, with a balance of light tone mixed with the darker tone. That’s why it was a successful film and the highest grossing comic book movie ever. With Wonder Woman, DC took two steps forward in making a good DC movie, but then took two steps back from an unbalanced Justice League film, which was made because of the mistake of over using the light tone for the whole film. This killed any emotional content or gritty drama from the film, turning it into a happy go lucky tone, which is why Steppenwolf came off as this weak ass villain on screen and just a punching bag for Superman.  General Zod and Doomsday we’re more formidable challenges for Superman, which Steppenwolf should’ve been more than a challenge being a new god.   I'm sorry to say this, even as a DC fan, this film is a weak dumbed down movie just to appease the fanboys complaining about the darker tone, instead of getting a balanced film to make Steppenwolf a bad ass on screen and looking menacing, plus  allowing emotional context in the film; but we get an over light toned Marvel Avengers 2.5 film which felt like a disappointment instead.   This film should've been like Wonder Woman with a balance of light tones in certain scenes that needed humor and darker tones for the villain and drama scenes to give some emotionally grounded substance to the film which, sadly, this is not what we got. I blame Joss Whedon and the CEO of Warner bros for this messy film. So people need to stop blaming critics and fans for bad reviews for the drop in box office sales, the film does that itself. I warned ages ago if Warner bros turns DC into Marvel, it will backfire because the characters of DC are darker than the ones in Marvel and that's just a fact. By making this film over the top light toned DC lost its identity which sadly could cost this universe.   The only way Warner bros can fix this mess: is to separate Warner Bros from DC, have a contract so no CEO can interfere in the progress of the film, and let the directors make the film without interference. This is the problem DC is having with Warner Bros interfering in things they don't have a clue in.   All Warner Bros should be doing is marketing and stop interfering in the director's work. Marvel doesn't have that much inference other than Disney’s control over the ratings for the films. Warner bros should be doing the same, but not copying this childish tone. If DC can get every film with a balance like Wonder Woman, trust me, DC films would be successful. As far as Justice League’s film goes, it’s a sloppy mess thanks to “micromanagement” which needs to stop.   I believe Patty Jerkins would've had a better result than Joss with finishing this film because she has a greater respect for Snyder’s work than Joss does. No offense to people that say Joss is good at what he does in directing, but he’s not that good because Avengers 2 was a mediocre film at best, and if you look back at the Alien 3 film, a script was written from Joss Whedon which was one of the ten scripts reject for Alien 3, where we would’ve of had a power rangers style ending with xenomorphs (I.E giant robot style with xenomorphs joining together). which you can see just how much of a hack he really is. After box office opening weekend being low, from what I've heard he is fired from Bat-girl film project which I hope is true after this sloppy mess.
title: What Went Wrong with the Justice League Film
name: 489-revision-v1

content: Welcome to the very first installment of Hiro’s “IT Side of Things”. I’ll discuss random topics, brought up by the readers, the Laggin’ Out Staff, and our community. I’ll write about things from product reviews, IT perspectives on major issues, and even game reviews, should I be invited to do so. I’m hoping to even include some perspectives in Podcasts, occasionally. That said, let’s dive into the IT Side of Things. As many people have noticed, as of December 14th, the FCC will hold a vote concerning Net Neutrality. This vote will decide if the distribution of the internet to Americans will return to old regulations we held, and adopt the “Restoring Internet Freedom Order”. This will remove what was known as the “Open Internet Order” invoked by former President Obama back in 2015. The major factor of the OIO (Open Internet Order) was that it reclassified Broadband ISPs as “Title II” Providers under the Communications Act. This act is what forced the ISP giants to provide their internet services unchecked, clean, and raw.   Before this measure was enacted, there were numerous incidents which I’ve identified dating all the way back to 2002, where different ISPs were throttling internet speeds, based on traffic content, source or destination IP, and even outright blocked traffic from their competitors. Throttling is the act of reducing the allowable speeds of transfer of data across a network link. For example: if I were to send you a data file across the internet, you could get a potential download speed of around 700 Mbps. What the ISPs were doing back then amounted to me sending you (or anybody) a file, and because the ISP didn’t like me for whatever reason, they decided that you didn’t need to get my file as fast as possible, and would cut my transfer speed to you down to 50 Mbps. Since then, the ISP giants have been sued many times for violating the free web, and of course lost their cases, which is one of the events that prompted the OIO to be put in place.   So on December 14th, the vote will be held by the Commissioners of the FCC. Three of the seated Commissioners are Republican, and technically, three are Democratic, however, one chair is empty. The seated Republicans are against Net Neutrality, and the seated Democrats are in favor of it. We can see where this is going, I’m sure.   So what does the loss of Net Neutrality do to the American Public? Let’s break it down. Since the broadband ISP industry suddenly loses their Title II Carrier classification, they are no longer mandated to provide internet to you unmolested, unchanged, unmodified. The Title II Carrier classification identifies an entity or provider as a “public service provider” such as a telephone service provider. Without this classification they will be able to throttle, block, or alter content based upon their judgement. As in, if there is traffic that they have determined is sourced from a competitor, they can block it. If they feel you are eating up too much of their bandwidth without paying for premium service, they can throttle you. If they don’t like your traffic, they can block it, all without informing you of these modifications. They will also be allowed to provide preferential treatment of their business partners as well. Even more disconcerting is the fact that ISPs will be able to charge internet based companies for access to their customers. That’s right, your Netflix could be blocked if Netflix doesn’t pay fees to Comcast. Costs that would also be reflected in your membership to Netflix.   Furthermore, let’s look at another possibility. The broadband ISPs of America can decide to distribute the internet in a cable stylized format, all complete with your standard “Social Media Service package,” “Instant Messenger Package,” “News Package,” “Email Package,” “Web Browsing Package,” and finally, your “Streaming Video Package,” each one with an additional charge. Is this possible? Yes. Is this likely? I don’t know. What I can tell you is some more facts to digest.   Comcast’s major counter argument against Net Neutrality is quite a logical, fact-filled, counter argument. Statistically, only 5% of a customer base within a network segment (a physical neighborhood), utilizes between 75% - 80% of the network capacity, and the biggest slowdown is caused by media streaming traffic. So they propose a “Fast Lane” concept to be implemented. The idea is to cap overall basic internet access at a transfer rate (don’t know the specified transfer rate) so that it leaves more overall potential capacity to be available to the people that pay extra for the fast lane. In this way, it frees up more bandwidth to those that want to use streaming services on these technically faster connections.   Ironically enough, Comcast has proposed this idea as a counter to the concept of an unregulated internet. Most ISPs, for the lack of a better description, publicly promised to never do any of these particular “Evil Things” to our interwebz. However, most ISPs have also strongly opposed laws that would prevent them from doing any of those things. Comcast also promptly removed their written promise to never change the way they distribute services once the FCC chairman, Ajit Pai, publicly announced the vote to remove the current version of Net Neutrality. Ironic, isn’t it? Clearly, we see who is going to be a major culprit in the death of Net Neutrality.   Another of the major arguments that ISPs tout against, Net Neutrality happens to be the concept of “innovation” being limited by this law. The only restriction to innovation I could possibly see is the restriction on innovative ways to charge consumers. The FCC says they’re “Restoring Internet Freedom” and they don’t mean the freedom of the consumers, or your freedom in particular. The FCC’s new order seeks to absolve themselves of authority over the entire internet industry. Yeah… Ok… Not sure why this is happening, or how this is going to fly, but it’s something. This however, probably won’t take legitimate shape after the vote for a good while.   I foresee the vote going down the party line, and then immediately following that, since the Democrats disagree with the majority, they will be filing a dissent (also known as minority reports) explaining their point of views in the matter, and why they disagree with the order that the FCC is proposing. This beast is 210 pages long, and full of legal jargon. If you care to poke a look at it, let me know, I’ve downloaded it to look into it at a later time. This particular action is going to incite a long drawn out battle that could take the better part of a few years. There will be a lot of legal things happening at that point, to include a large number of lawsuits and petitions for review. To be certain, I foresee this going pretty high in the court systems, and short of an appearance of the Supreme Court in the matter, I don’t see it coming to conclusion any time soon. If anything is truly clear in this case, it’s that it will be a long and arduous matter. In fact, this could span into the next Presidential term, and we may have a completely different Supreme Judicial make-up at that time.   Ultimately, what this is going to boil down to, is petitioning our own government to stop this thing from happening, and hoping that not only will our words be seen, but the public’s voice will be heard. How this affects the IT community? It will certainly affect how tech is handled in the business world. It affects everybody’s attitude towards it, and, if it starts getting billed differently, it may even make it so cumbersome, that the majority of the country decides it’s not worth having, and just stops subscribing to it, thus forcing the ISP businesses to stop their bull, and start marketing things the way they were meant to be.   I am Hiro, the resident Tech Geek of Laggin’ Out Entertainment, and this has been your very first dose of “The IT Side of Things.”
title: The IT Side of Things: Net Neutrality
name: 486-revision-v1

content: —written by Penguingod      Hey everybody, Penguin again with a “Special Edition” review. Today’s topic is a game that has been out since March 25th 2013 on PC, releasing on PS4 in November later that year, then finally coming to Xbox One in September the next year, ( thanks for the beta test, noobs!) I am of course talking about Warframe; one of the crown jewels of the free-to-play games on any platform.     Now I call this a “Special Edition” review because i'm going to be diving deep into the game and breaking down certain aspects of this title. This will be a bit longer but I’ll be cracking some jokes along the way so it will be entertaining as well.     Let’s start with a quick overview of this game. You play as the ancient Tenno,  a “Space Ninja Pirate Mercenary,” and yes you read that right, bent on bringing down the human race... Wait, what the fuck? That’s right, the main enemy faction that you face in the game is called the Grineer and they are the cloned descendants of the human race, but greatly modified with technology to make them look and sound fucking disgusting. The Grineer are not the only enemies that you face as you take on the money tyrants of the Corpus, a clan of currency mongers and crazy scientists that sound like Owen Wilson saying “Wow” when the die. Then there is the ancient enemy to all civilization, the Flood. Oops! I mean the Infested. These creepy crawlers resemble the Flood from a series that won’t be named. They infect hosts, their environment, and even technology and weapons. Yes, there are weapons in the game that are infected, including a melee weapon where you throw spores like freakin kunai.     The game is cool in the aspect of setting and location as you travel to different planets and moons in the Solar System and even an area called The Void, a place of cosmic phenomenon that holds many secrets, including the source of the Tenno’s power. The Orokin, which was a civilization wiped out long ago, kinda like the Forerunners, (cough* cough*), left behind towers in The Void to keep outsiders away and hold inside the secrets as well, which these towers are where you go if doing void missions. They also left behind technology all over the “Star Map,” ( which is the map navigation for travel), with fancy looking ivory and gold trim so you can’t miss any of it.     Now to pros of this game; the thing I like the most about Warframe is the killing of enemies. Nothing is better then shooting some Grinner lancer’s dome off or cutting a Corpus crewman in half (vertically) with a katana like sword. The variety of weapons that are available in game are great too, from flamethrowers to bows, from LMGs to giant war hammers or even a revolver for all you cowboys out there. Of course certain weapons excel in certain situations so picking and choosing what is needed is essential.     The suits that you play as are called Warframes, which are controlled by the Tenno, that sits in a machine ( it’s complicated), and there are plenty of different Frames too. What’s even better is the different back stories that each Frame has, like how Nidus is a Frame that was Infected, Octavia (bae), is music oriented and has an ability where she casts a little music ball that rolls around and pulls aggro while playing music that you can create different beats for. Mesa, the Frame that I play as, has an ability where she pulls out two handgun like weapons and locks on to enemies, shooting them in rapid succession, which can be useful in certain situations.      The gameplay is fun, as you climb walls and do some fancy acrobatics like a ninja ( as stated before). Plus the controls are not very hard to get the hang of as there is a slight button combination to be able to cover ground relatively quickly, doing flips and shit in the air. The Star Map is really cool too, being able to travel all across the Solar System with even a certain place that travels around the map called “Kuva Fortress”, which is a Grineer stronghold made out of asteroids and a space station.     The in depth builds that you can make is great as you can shape your load-out to your type of play. You can go with stealth, using a bow or melee weapon, or just grab a gun and blast some space fools. The wide range of mods help make a lot of this possible as getting certain mods and progressing them up to max level is essential to get further in the game.      It’s a great co-op experience with having 4 players in a squad so you can tackle most missions ( though there are solo missions). There are raids that give the player a challenge as you have to work together with your group with up to 8 players to defy the odds and complete the goal. This game gives a good sense of accomplishment as farming and doing the daily grind pays off to get the weapons, mods, and Frames needed to be the ultimate shinobi any weeb could ask for.     The newest addition to the game adds an open world map that hasn’t been done to the game yet and grants a different side to the game. Plains of Eidolon is the biggest expansion that the developers have made to the game. This takes you to a savannah like place where the Grineer roam and the Tenno play. You can find pseudo raid bosses wandering the plains called “Eidolons,” which you have to complete little side objectives just to take one down and get all of it’s glorious loot that comes with it’s death. There is even fishing! Yes, catching fish has it’s significance too as trading in caught fish gives standing with the villagers (that look like a bunch of bald vultures), placed at the beginning of the expansion.     With this new free add-on comes a new Frame named Gaara of the sand. Oops, I was reading a Naruto manga, I meant Gara. This frame likes to play with glass as she uses it with all her abilities, creating shields and attacking enemies with shards of death. She can be obtained from completing bounties given by one of the locals in the village.     The cons (and this is going to get a little gruesome), shows that this game becomes a “meme” in some ways that will be mentioned. Some of the weapons that are in the game become useless after a certain point. Due to enemies becoming stronger in later levels.Some weapons that could have used a core re-work have been left untouched by the developers. Further more, as a cop-out, they tried to add special mods called “Riven Mods”. They are used to try and make these shitty weapons good, except if you put the mods on a gun that’s good already then it becomes god status, thus making this whole process pointless.     The dialogue in this game is why I mentioned this title turns into a meme. Some of the antagonists, such as Alad V, make you shake your head in utter disappointment, while another, named Vay Hek, is angrily yelling at you for no apparent reason other then the fact that he is literally a flying turd that turns into a turkey when you battle him. Then you have some characters on your side, like The Lotus, who won’t tell you things that are needed, instead telling you shit you already know and won’t shut the hell up about it. Next, comes the cat scratch on a chalkboard known only as Maroo, who, if you do not want to punch your TV after she says “antiquities!”, then you have the mental patience of a god.     The AI is quite jank in a lot of different ways. For one, the level scaling gets out of hand as you go from shitting on the enemies to getting shitted on by said enemies. This complicates things as you will need an experienced group with some god tier builds to get to some higher leveled areas. Also, the game becomes a pain in the ass. If you do not have friends in a group once you hit a certain point in the game, soloing becomes next to impossible unless your have a really good build to back you up. Stealth also becomes useless when the enemies will detect you, even when you try sneaking up on them and being the stealthy little space ninja you are told to be. This kinda throws out the concept of being a stealth ninja as it pays more to be loud and proud than silent and strident.     The guys at “Digital Extremes” need to be more in touch with their game. There are plenty of things that go on in the game that needed fixing but have a blind eye turned to instead. Such as stated before with the weapon cop-outs, the enemies being scaled from the depths of hell, and the various glitches that appear here and there are all things that could be fixed but are not.     Last, Maroo... because this god damned, annoying as, pickles esque (from Borderlands Pre-sequel), cow turd needs one last hoorah for how fucking annoying she is. Nothing is more redundant than her saying “tin suits” over and over again till my damned ears bleed and I’m left lying on the floor while my dog licks my face and try’s to get me to pet her. Also, THE VOICE!!!!! Still, Vay Hek’s dumb ass, even though he has none, is constantly yelling at me for shit I hadn’t even done yet. Does this dude always talk like this? Can you imagine being the guy on the phone with him while he’s trying to order a pizza? Don’t get me started on Alad V either. This flamboyant asshat laughs at his own shitty one-liners like they were supposed to be funny. I could see myself walking into a room and seeing Alad V standing there in nothing but a towel on, saying “hehe hey Tenno, you just caught me getting out of the shower hehe”. These mother fuckers are the true memes of Warframe.     Even with these cons, this game has become quite a fun adventure. Running around and cutting down enemies turns this game into the ultimate weeb simulator that any Naruto loving baka would enjoy. I'm gonna slap an 8.5/10 on this bad boy and call it good. I’d like to take this time and give a shout out to a sexy friend of mine (he’s single, ladies), by the name of T3nac1ous E. Without him, this review would have been shit. Well everyone, that’s it for this one, till next, this is Penguin, slidin’ off the ice!
title: Warframe: The Ultimate Space Ninja Showdown
name: 480-revision-v1

content: LuminescentRuby                 Battleborn, a first person shooter developed by 2K and published by Gearbox Software, was released in May 2016. While meant to be played cooperatively with others, the game does allow for a solo play through of the campaign missions when the multiplayer modes just aren’t your thing.     Set in a space fantasy world, players take up the role of one of 30 heroes called “Battleborn,” who fight to save the star known as Solus from a great enemy called the Varelsi. These heroes travel to as many places as possible to recruit allies in their fight and prevent those who would destroy Solus from getting further towards their goal.   Combat in this game is comparable to games like Overwatch, but adds a few quirks of its own. Unlike other FPS titles, Battleborn uses elements of “Multiplayer Online Battle Arena” (or simply MOBA) type games. While in game, players can level up, earn new abilities, and augment existing ones to grow stronger during a match, similar to the way character progression works in League of Legends. Characters have a multitude of abilities, unlocking new ones and perks through the game’s “Helix Tree” upgrade system. These abilities only pertain to the current match and reset when a new one occurs. It sounds complicated at first, but It’s actually really easy to get used to when you find the character that fits your playstyle. Battleborn characters come in three categories: Melee, Ranged, and Support, so finding the type that fits best really does make the game unique. People who are more comfortable supporting their team rather than fighting may wish to use a hero like Miko, who can heal teammates, while those who want to attack but not get too close to danger may use characters like Beatrix, who can act as a sniper.   Playable modes in the game include the story driven “Mission Mode”, which provides not only character backgrounds, but in-universe lore for playable heroes, as well as the multiplayer modes Meltdown, Incursion, Capture,  Face-off, and Supercharge.     Meltdown is a mode where players are split into 2 teams of 5. Each must fight off the enemy team and their robots while escorting their AI robots to be sacrificed. Incursion sees the game get the closest it can get to a MOBA by having the 2 teams of 5 fight to capture the opponent’s base while defending their own from being taken, seen most prominently in games like League of Legends and Heroes of the Storm. Capture is a mode where the teams will attempt to capture and hold several key points on a map, preventing the other team from encroaching on them.     Face-off, one of two multiplayer modes added later, still features 2 teams of five, but plays out rather differently. Instead of going head to head against each other directly, the teams will instead compete to hoard the most masks taken from AI controlled mobs of Varelsi enemies. This is quite different for a game like this, and it works rather well, providing a different kind of fun that most would not expect. Our final multiplayer mode, Supercharge, the second of the two modes added later, upends the 2 teams of 5 formula to make a 3v3 game mode. This mode is very similar to the Meltdown, but has added capturable Supercharge Pads, which grant advantages to the team that gets to them.  All the multiplayer modes can be found in some form in similar games of the same genre, but manages to put such a unique spin on them that it makes them special to this title and feels really fresh in contrast to the multitudes of “Team Deathmatch” out there.   The best part of the game really has to be the characters and the universe. All the characters have interesting backstories and motivations, and they’re fighting to stop the last star in the world from being destroyed. Borderlands fans will certainly latch onto the humor immediately, as well as the loot drops in the game. Though the game does feature content to buy, unlike other games these days, all content that can be bought can be done so in game, and isn’t randomized. You want a character you need to buy? Then just play the game, earn in-game currency, and buy that character! Progression may seem daunting, but also feels really great when one does get used to it.   The only bad thing that can really be said about it is that it may take time to learn to play and some might not see the point in doing so. FPS fans will need to learn to integrate some of the MOBA aspects of it into their repertoire, and that can be a very hard thing to do. This is especially the case since people by this time have to explore at least 30 characters, their abilities, and their play sets as well. This is a lot of requirements, and can easily turn casuals away.   A big factor in the game’s reception is how the game got overshadowed by the release of Blizzard’s game Overwatch a few weeks after it came out. Players got caught up in the wave of hype that came with it, and many dropped Battleborn for it. Despite the drop in active players, we have a great game here held up only by a daunting new attempt at modifying the FPS gameplay. There really is a lot to like here, and it easily earns this reviewer’s score of 8.5/10. It’s a unique take on FPS games, and really deserves a look with all the features and modes it has currently! If you haven’t played it yet, let me know if I interested you. If you have played, tell me what you think of it!  As always, I’m LuminescentRuby, shining a glow to reveal just how good this game really is!
title: Battleborn PS4 Review

content: —Written by Penguingod    Hey guys, Penguin here. So today I’m going to be doing a review for The Evil Within 2, even though I am a day late and a dollar short for this one, you can’t rush greatness, and they didn’t with this game. As a forewarning to anyone reading this, I will be talking about story based spoilers so if you are not into all that jive you might want to take your leave here.     The story takes place picking up two years after the events of Evil Within 1, where the main protagonist, Sebastian Castellanos or “Seb,” goes through a series of horrifying events in a machine called STEM. While inside this machine, he has to battle the conscious of Ruben Victoriano or “Ruvik,” a mad scientist and the original creator of STEM. The story becomes the most convoluted and confusing plot as nothing in the game is explained (even in the ending), until you buy the first two DLCs to complete the story that only fill about 85% of the plot holes ( good marketing ploy, Bethesda).     Luckily, the second installment to this series doesn’t follow suit. The story is not as confusing or has millions of plot holes like driving on a road after a monsoon. As it is a direct sequel to the first game, it has its own story that makes many connections here and there throughout the game to it’s predecessor. The game starts off 2 years after the first one with Seb being torn apart by the loss of his family. It begins with a nightmarish dream of him trying to save his daughter from their house burning down (this part was a tear jerker). Then he is rudely awakened at a bar, trying to drown his sorrows, by his old partner Juli Kidman, who betrayed him in the first game.     She tells him that his daughter is not dead, instead she was kidnapped by an underground company known as Mobius, to be used as the “Core” for a new STEM machine. Kidman asks for his help as Lily (Seb’s kid), needs saving because the system is going on the fritz and weird things are happening. He agrees, thus starting the nightmare all over again.     This game takes an even more eery turn as giant crazy monster with a saw blade for her right hand, chases after you almost right away and you are thrown into the hell that is known as Union: a town that was meant to be peaceful plunged into an obscured reality. The streets are riddled with zombie like people, creatures that crawl on the ground (that I greatly hated), abominations that spew gas and will stun you if hit with said gas, and eventually friends turned flamethrower guys (looking at you, Liam). These types of enemies sure make for quite the hellish scenery.     The combat in this game is a hit and miss. The game wants you to utilize stealth and hidden tactics greatly. In theory this is plausible, until you are sitting in a bush (which is supposed to conceal you), and an enemy comes waltzing across the play area, questing you out, auto spots you and kills you (a broken game mechanic if you will). Luckily enough, I found a glitch with the ambush perk where you can stealth kill enemies even if they have spotted you out and are coming to kill you ( the good guys at Bethesda). Plus the boss fights don’t punish you if you go into them without a lot of ammo ( which was me doing a dry run on the hardest difficulty), as they have ammo lying around that regenerate quickly. Sadly enough the controls can be a little jank and will get you killed more than you’d like.     The story takes its toll as you feel for Seb and the situation that he has once more been dragged into. Exploring around a semi-open world gives the perks of finding out about the main protagonist and a lot of the trauma he has gone through in his past. They even have collectibles scattered around the game that pay homage to other Bethesda titles, such as The Elder Scrolls Online emblem as a trophy.       You get experience esque points such as “Green Gel” to unlock new abilities and skills. These abilities help so you will not get completely slaughtered like a Dark Souls character. You can also collect “Weapon Parts,” which help you make your guns and crossbow bolts ( yes, I said crossbow) better, some of which these upgrades will give extra abilities to your arsenal as well.       You find out that your missing wife, who disappeared after your daughter “died,” is inside the STEM too. Sadly, she ends up sacrificing herself so you and Lily can make a grand escape from the machine, as well as Mobius, with the help from Kidman, who turncoat once again ( this time to do the right thing). After all the torment, you get a nice little happy ending of Seb and Lily riding off into the sunset.     Through the hell that this game sets you in, it is definitely a great horror game. It had me jumping and screaming like a teenager at “Crystal Lake” who just found their BFF dead and some weird dude in a mask standing behind her with a machete. It’s plot makes for a great story as its survival horror has you grasping on to bare essentials just to get by in the game. It even has a great pedigree from the original creator of Resident Evil, the esteemed Shinji Mikami. This title is definitely my favorite of the year and I would recommend it to anyone who loves these types of games and would be willing to try Bethesda’s take on the horror scene. 10/10 would play again. Well that’s it for this one, till next time, this is Penguin, slidin’ off the ice.
title: The Evil Within 2: A Horror Revisited
name: 478-autosave-v1

Then he is rudely awakened at a bar, trying to drown his sorrows, by his old partner Juli Kidman, who betrayed him in the first game.     She tells him that his daughter is not dead, instead she was kidnapped by an underground company known as Mobius, to be used as the “Core” for a new STEM machine. Kidman asks for his help as Lily (Seb’s kid), needs saving because the system is going on the fritz and weird things are happening. He agrees, thus starting the nightmare all over again.     This game takes an even more eery turn as giant crazy monster with a saw blade for her right hand, chases after you almost right away and you are thrown into the hell that is known as Union: a town that was meant to be peaceful plunged into an obscured reality. The streets are riddled with zombie like people, creatures that crawl on the ground (that I greatly hated), abominations that spew gas and will stun you if hit with said gas, and eventually friends turned flamethrower guys (looking at you, Liam). These types of enemies sure make for quite the hellish scenery.     The combat in this game is a hit and miss. The game wants you to utilize stealth and hidden tactics greatly. In theory this is plausible, until you are sitting in a bush (which is supposed to conceal you), and an enemy comes waltzing across the play area, questing you out, auto spots you and kills you (a broken game mechanic if you will). Luckily enough, I found a glitch with the ambush perk where you can stealth kill enemies even if they have spotted you out and are coming to kill you ( the good guys at Bethesda). Plus the boss fights don’t punish you if you go into them without a lot of ammo ( which was me doing a dry run on the hardest difficulty), as they have ammo lying around that regenerate quickly. Sadly enough the controls can be a little jank and will get you killed more than you’d like.     The story takes its toll as you feel for Seb and the situation that he has once more been dragged into. Exploring around a semi-open world gives the perks of finding out about the main protagonist and a lot of the trauma he has gone through in his past. They even have collectibles scattered around the game that pay homage to other Bethesda titles, such as The Elder Scrolls Online emblem as a trophy.       You get experience esque points such as “Green Gel” to unlock new abilities and skills. These abilities help so you will not get completely slaughtered like a Dark Souls character. You can also collect “Weapon Parts,” which help you make your guns and crossbow bolts ( yes, I said crossbow) better, some of which these upgrades will give extra abilities to your arsenal as well.       You find out that your missing wife, who disappeared after your daughter “died,” is inside the STEM too. Sadly, she ends up sacrificing herself so you and Lily can make a grand escape from the machine, as well as Mobius, with the help from Kidman, who turncoat once again ( this time to do the right thing). After all the torment, you get a nice little happy ending of Seb and Lily riding off into the sunset.     Through the hell that this game sets you in, it is definitely a great horror game. It had me jumping and screaming like a teenager at “Crystal Lake” who just found their BFF dead and some weird dude in a mask standing behind her with a machete. It’s plot makes for a great story as its survival horror has you grasping on to bare essentials just to get by in the game. It even has a great pedigree from the original creator of Resident Evil, the esteemed Shinji Mikami. This title is definitely my favorite of the year and I would recommend it to anyone who loves these types of games and would be willing to try Bethesda’s take on the horror scene. 10/10 would play again. Well that’s it for this one, till next time, this is Penguin, slidin’ off the ice.
title: The Evil Within 2: A Horror Revisited
name: 478-revision-v1

content: Written by Poop Master    The day of reckoning is getting closer and closer for our favorite super heroes. Thanos and his league of evil doers are certainly letting us know they are here to kick ass and collect the remaining “Infinity Stones.”      The trailer kicks off with Nick Fury’s line of “There was an idea” from way back when the Avengers were still being assembled. Reminding us of how far our Earth bound heroes have come from, to fighting a universal threat. Afterwards it flashes between scenes of: Doctor Strange and Wong, Vision (still with his Infinity Stone) with Scarlet Witch, Natasha, and Bruce Banner with part of the Hulk Buster armor.      Pedestrians flee from the streets and we see Peter Parker’s arm hairs stand up with a look of concern on his face, which shows that Peter now understands his Spider Sense, as he looks to a ominous metal ring over the skyline. The next few shots are: Loki handing the Tesseract to a person we can't see, Thanos popping out of a portal, Spider Man in his rad :Iron Spider” suit, “The Hulk Buster” suit, and T’challa saying “Someone get this man a shield.” as Steve Rodgers emerges from the shadows.      Suddenly the tone shifts as we see war breaking out. The Avengers are facing some force of black demon creatures, presumably Thanos’ army. Spider Man gets slammed into the ground by Thanos and we see the Specter touching Vision’s “Mind” stone. Finally we reach the crescendo of the trailer: Thanos wielding the Infinity Gauntlet but with only the “Power” and “Space” stone. A quick shot of Iron Man being punched to the ground by the newly powered Thanos. The trailer ends with a shot of Winter Soldier, Black Widow, Captain America, Hulk, Black Panther, and an Wakanda army.      Now more than ever we need our heroes together as a team when they face a Herculean threat like Thanos. We see him with 2 of the Stones so far, someone tampering with Visions, Steven with the Eye of Agamotto, the Aether was seen in Ragnarok, but the Soul Stone’s location  has yet to be confirmed. May 4th, 2018 is the release date and it will forever change the Marvel cinematic universe.
title: Infinity War Trailer Breakdown
name: 463-revision-v1

content: -LuminescentRuby       The new games have been revealed for Microsoft’s Games with Gold, with at least $105 USD worth of games for free.       The free games with Gold is only 4 games per month, 2 Xbox One and 2 Xbox 360 games and they also alternate between themselves through the month. These savings can be enormous, so it’s a great way to save.       Here’s a look at the games you can get now:   XBOX ONE:       Warhammer: End Times - Vermintide is a co-op game in the same vein as Left 4 Dead.  Set in the world of Warhammer Fantasy, players must choose a role so they can beat back the hordes of invading Skaven. This game is multiplayer only, so fans looking to play solo may want to pass and look elsewhere, but for those ok with marching on with friends, this game definitely could be for you. Normally priced at $39.99, Vermintide will be free from December 1st to December 31st.       Also for Xbox One, we have Back to the Future: The Game - 30th Anniversary Edition. Set after the ending of Back to the Future III, players see Marty McFly off on another time bending adventure when a driverless DeLorean shows up in present day! This is a game from Telltale Games, so players can expect to make meaningful choices in solving what’s going on. Usually priced at $19.99, players can find this game for free between December 16th through January 15th, so you’ve got quite a bit of time to jump on this one!   XBOX 360:       Starting our Xbox 360 games, we have Child of Eden. This musical adventure game is full of vibrant sounds and colors, and is considered somewhat of a spiritual successor to the game Rez. This game for is available free until December 15th.       Our last game here is called Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death. This little title is a hack and slash game in third person set in the Mayan jungle, paying homage to action movies and comic book heroes. Your goal as the titular Marlow Briggs is to save the world. You can find this game free until December 31st, so if it fits your style of game, you’re in luck.       These games make up the selection of the free Games With Gold for December, and there are some real steals here. Its worth at least looking into, and these are no small deal games. This is a solid offering here, and there’s plenty of time to get in on these, so make tracks to the Live store now if you want in on these deals! This is LuminescentRuby, shining a glow on these deals and signing out! title: Xbox Live Games With Gold December 2017
